title: Long Term - Remote Admin Assistant
description:
Long-Term Remote Admin Assistant (Australian Electrical Company)



Location: Philippines (Remote)

Employer: Sydney-based Electrical Services Business

Job Type: Full-time (20 hrs/week)

Work Hours: Aligned with Australian Eastern Standard Time (AEST)



About the Role



We are a growing Australian electrical company based in Sydney looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Admin Assistant to join us long-term. This role is 100% remote and ideal for someone who enjoys admin work, customer communication, and supporting a small but busy trade business.



We value loyalty, consistency, and clear communication and are looking for someone who wants a stable, ongoing role, not short-term work.



Key Responsibilities



Answer phone calls and respond to
s/messages



Book and schedule jobs for electricians



Create and send quotes and invoices



Follow up unpaid invoices and customer enquiries



Update job details in our job management system



Data entry and record keeping



General admin support as required



(Training will be provided for our systems.)



Requirements



Previous experience as an Admin Assistant or Virtual Assistant



Strong spoken and written English



Confident with computers,
, and online tools



Highly organised and able to manage multiple tasks



Reliable internet connection and quiet home workspace



Honest, punctual, and able to work independently



Nice to Have (Not Required):



Experience working with Australian clients



Experience in construction, trades, or electrical businesses



Familiarity with invoicing or basic bookkeeping



Salary & Benefits



205 PHP to 370 PHP per hour (depending on experience)



Paid training



Stable, long-term employment



Friendly Australian employer



Opportunity for pay increases as the role grows



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



To apply, please include all of the following:



Your resume

Answer this question in your application:

‚ÄúWhy do you think you would be a good fit for a small Australian electrical business?‚Äù



Applications that do not follow the instructions may not be considered.

title: Sales - Freight Broker Agent (Remote / US-Based Logistics)
description:
Sales Freight Broker Agent (Remote / US-Based Logistics)

Company:  BDL

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Shift: US Business Hours (MT)

Commission-Based Compensation Only: High Percentage and Uncapped Commissions with the real possibility to earn between $5,000 to over $8,000 USD for the right person who is a master at Sales with a U.S. transportation background in freight brokering. MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE AND THE DRIVE TO WIN!!! If you don't have the experience, DO NOT APPLY!



Job Overview

We are seeking a high-energy, results-driven Sales Freight Broker Agent to join our growing US-based logistics team. In this role, you will serve as the vital link between shippers and carriers, managing the entire shipment lifecycle from prospecting through delivery. The ideal candidate has an entrepreneurial spirit and a "hunter" mindset for new business.



Key Responsibilities

Lead Generation & Prospecting: Proactively identify and cold-call potential shippers to build a robust sales pipeline.

Negotiation: Negotiate freight rates with both shippers and carriers to ensure maximum profit margins.

Carrier Management: Source, vet, and maintain relationships with reliable carriers to move customer freight.

Load Management: Book loads, track shipments in real-time, and provide proactive updates to clients.

Problem Solving: Resolve logistical issues, such as equipment failures or weather delays, to ensure on-time delivery.



Qualifications

Experience: Minimum 1 year of experience as a US freight brokerage agent or carrier sales.

Industry Knowledge: Familiarity with US trucking regulations, load boards (DAT, Truckstop), and TMS platforms.

Communication: Exceptional English verbal and written communication skills; must be comfortable with high-volume outbound calling. Using a CRM and good follow-up. 



Skills: Strong negotiation, multi-tasking, and analytical skills. 

Setup: Must have a reliable high-speed internet connection and a quiet workspace.

What We Offer is one of the industry's best commission structures with unlimited potential to earn $$$. 

Growth Potential: Opportunities to build your own "Book of Business" within the company.

Training: Ongoing professional development in global logistics and US market trends.

title: Experienced Video Editor for Faceless YouTube Channel (Survival / Gardening / Homesteading Niche)
description:
Looking for an Experienced Video Editor for Faceless YouTube Channel (Survival / Gardening / Homesteading Niche)



We‚Äôre looking for a reliable editor who can produce quality videos for our faceless YouTube channel in the survival, gardening, and homesteading niche.



Right now, we handle the editing ourselves using Canva (video + B-roll + images) along with CapCut for transitions and additional elements. We‚Äôre ready to bring someone on who can take over this role and grow with us.



Our average video length is about 18 minutes, and we‚Äôre looking for a minimum of 3 videos per week, with 4 per week being ideal once you‚Äôre comfortable with our pacing and style.



Pay: Flat fee of $15 USD per video

Start: Immediately



Most of our content is list-style videos. The editing itself isn‚Äôt technically complex, but it does require time and strong attention to detail because visuals need to closely match what‚Äôs being discussed.



Attention to detail is extremely important to us.

We have a mature, detail-oriented audience, so we are not looking for fast or sloppy work. The videos need to feel intentional, well-paced, and visually aligned with the narration.



Typical responsibilities include:



Mixing images and video clips throughout



Adding rolling titles and on-screen text



Matching visuals carefully to narration points



Background music layering (we provide the soundtracks)



Occasionally adding short clips (for example from TikTok, depending on the topic)



We will provide:



Access to Canva Pro (if you don‚Äôt already have it)



Access to our Leonardo AI account for unlimited image/video generation when needed



All background music tracks



Example videos for reference (links attached)



You‚Äôll mainly be responsible for sourcing visuals (public domain, stock, web images, etc.), selecting appropriate music from our provided tracks, and assembling the videos according to our style.



===== We can pay weekly via Wise. =====



Also, strong English comprehension is very important for this role. You need to clearly understand the concepts we‚Äôre discussing so you can accurately source videos, images, and content that match what‚Äôs being said. Attention to detail really matters to us.



We will provide the full written scripts for each video, so you‚Äôll be able to follow along step-by-step and know exactly what we‚Äôre looking for in terms of visuals and pacing.



If you‚Äôre interested, please review the sample videos linked so you can understand our pacing, quality, and style.:

title: CINC Systems Expert ‚Äì Configuration, Modules & Automation (HOA / Condo)
description:
Job Title

CINC Systems Expert ‚Äì Configuration, Modules & Automation (HOA / Condo)



READ THIS FIRST 

This role is for someone with deep, hands-on ownership of CINC Systems.

If your experience is limited to using CINC, assisting with setup, or following instructions created by someone else, do not apply.

We are specifically looking for someone who has built, configured, and owned multiple parts of CINC Systems in real HOA/Condo environments.



ROLE SUMMARY 

We are hiring a CINC Systems expert with a deep understanding of how CINC works end-to-end. You will be responsible for configuring, improving, and supporting multiple CINC modules, automations, workflows, and reporting structures.

This is not a narrow role. You are expected to understand how different modules interact and how configuration decisions impact operations, accounting, boards, and homeowners.



CORE RESPONSIBILITIES 

You will personally:

‚Ä¢ Configure and maintain CINC Systems environments

‚Ä¢ Set up, customize, and optimize multiple CINC modules, such as:

o     Violations

o     Work Orders / Maintenance

o     Accounting-related workflows

o    Owner & Board portals

o    Vendors and services

o    Reporting and dashboards

‚Ä¢ Build and manage:

o    Automation rules

o    Triggers and workflows

o    Custom fields and layouts

‚Ä¢ Support system launches, migrations, and cleanups

‚Ä¢ Create clear documentation for system logic and configuration

‚Ä¢ Troubleshoot complex CINC issues independently

‚Ä¢ Act as a senior internal resource before escalating to CINC support



REQUIRED EXPERIENCE  (Non-Negotiable)

You must clearly demonstrate all of the following:

‚Ä¢ Direct, hands-on experience building inside CINC Systems

‚Ä¢ Experience configuring multiple CINC modules, not just one

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of how CINC behaves across:

o    Operations

o    Accounting

o    Compliance

o    Board and homeowner workflows

‚Ä¢ Ability to explain why configuration and automation decisions were made

‚Ä¢ Comfort owning systems without step-by-step instructions

If you have only ‚Äúhelped,‚Äù ‚Äúassisted,‚Äù or ‚Äúsupported‚Äù CINC work created by others, this role is not a fit.



APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS 

Applicants should be prepared to:

‚Ä¢ Submit a resume with their application

‚Ä¢ Discuss systems they have personally built

‚Ä¢ Explain automation decisions and tradeoffs

‚Ä¢ Demonstrate ownership, not assistance

You will be asked to give real examples. General or vague answers will be disqualified.



WORKING CONIDTIONS 

‚Ä¢ Full-time remote, Independent Contractor

‚Ä¢ Flexible EST-aligned hours

o    Pre-launch: Flexible, provided deliverables and communication are met

o    Post-launch: Expected overlap with standard business hours (9‚Äì5 or 10‚Äì6 EST)

‚Ä¢ Occasional weekend work during launch phases

o    Not frequent

o    Communicated in advance

‚Ä¢ Time tracking required (Hubstaff)



Must have:

‚Ä¢ Personal computer used exclusively for work

‚Ä¢ Backup computer, internet, and power

‚Ä¢ Quiet, professional workspace



Compensation & Growth

‚Ä¢ $9/hour starting rate

‚Ä¢ Hourly rate increases based on performance and contribution

‚Ä¢ Long-term contractor relationship intended

‚Ä¢ Opportunity to help shape systems, processes, and your own role as Sliceo grows

This role is designed for someone looking for long-term stability and ownership, not short-term task work.



CONFIDENTIALITY 

This role involves access to sensitive systems, internal strategy, and proprietary information. Strict confidentiality is required.



REQUIRED APPLICATION QUESTIONS 

Applicants must answer the following:

Describe your hands-on experience with CINC Systems.



Include:

1. Which CINC modules you personally configured or built

2. One automation or workflow you owned end-to-end

3. A system decision you made and why you made it

4. How many years have you used CINC Systems?



***Applications without a resume or without clear ownership examples will not be reviewed.

title: Personal Brand & Social Media Strategist
description:
About the brand & role

I work in healthcare and create long form content on AI, healthcare, leadership, and systems thinking (mainly on Substack).



I‚Äôm looking for a social media VA/strategist to turn that content into short?form posts, manage day to day social presence, and help shape and strengthen the brand while designing and executing growth strategies. This is an expert led, credibility?driven brand, not a trend chasing influencer account. I‚Äôd like someone who can execute now and grow with the brand. I also work on medical education and curriculum projects, and there will be some light admin support related to those over time.



What you‚Äôll do

1. Content & creative: 

Turn long form posts into:

- 2‚Äì3 short form video scripts (Reels/TikTok)

- 1‚Äì2 carousel posts

- Adapt tone for Instagram, TikTok, and LinkedIn

- Keep voice and visuals consistent



2. Video, design & posting

- Edit vertical videos in CapCut (captions, clean overlays, light transitions)

- Create simple, professional graphics in Canva

- Schedule posts and monitor comments after posting

- Draft professional replies for my approval and flag sensitive comments



3. Growth & strategy

- Propose and test simple growth experiments (hooks, formats, posting times, CTAs, etc.)

- Track basic metrics and share monthly ‚Äúwhat worked / what to try next‚Äù insights

- Suggest collaborations, content ideas, and optimizations to grow reach and
 list

- Help refine and maintain brand positioning and visual/storytelling consistency over time



4. Light admin

- Format and schedule Substack posts, substack notes and LinkedIn (content provided)

- Maintain a simple content calendar and idea list

- Support administrative tasks for curriculum projects (organizing documents, basic research, slide or resource formatting)



Tools

Nice if you know some of these; you must be willing to learn: CapCut, Canva, Notion, Google Workspace, Slack, AI assistants, a password manager. Interest in learning new tools is a plus.



This role is for you if: 

- You‚Äôve managed or grown personal brands before

- You understand short form content strategy and basic analytics

- You‚Äôre excited about testing ideas and taking responsibility for growth, not just posting

- You can turn thoughtful writing into engaging short content

- You‚Äôre organized, reliable, and communicate clearly

- You take initiative but respect and protect the brand voice



Not a fit if: 

You only schedule posts, need constant supervision, copy trends without thinking about positioning, or lean on AI without judgment.



Compensation & growth

- USD $6‚Äì8/hour to start (depending on experience and portfolio)

- Trial phase: ~5 hours/week for the first month to test fit and workflows

- After trial: increase to ~10 hours/week, with potential to grow toward 15‚Äì20 hours/week

- Performance based bonuses and rate increases for reliability, initiative, and results



How to apply

Please include:

- A short intro (in your own voice) and why this role interests you.

- Links to 2‚Äì3 accounts you‚Äôve managed + what you did for each.

- Task: One example of turning a 1,000?word article into: 

1. One Reel idea (hook + 3‚Äì4 points)

2. One carousel outline (title + slide bullets)

- Your hourly rate and weekly availability (PH time).

- Optional but helpful: 1‚Äì2 ideas for growth or branding experiments you‚Äôd try in the first 60 days for an AI?in?healthcare personal brand

- Start your application with the word STRATEGY. Generic or low?effort applications won‚Äôt be reviewed.

title: Ad Creative Coordinator
description:
We manage multiple e-commerce brands and are looking for a reliable Creative Assembly & Ad Upload Specialist to join our team.

Your job is simple but important: take pre-made hook clips and body clips from our video editors, combine them into final ad creatives, then upload them into Meta Ads Manager and set up campaigns following our exact SOPs.

This is NOT a strategy role. You won't make decisions on budgets, targeting, or creative direction. You follow clear instructions and SOPs precisely.

What you'll do:



Combine hook clips + body clips into finished ad creatives using CapCut

Export in the correct formats and specs

Upload finished creatives into Meta Ads Manager

Create campaigns with the correct landing page, naming conventions, and settings as outlined in our SOPs

Communicate via Slack



What we're looking for:



Experience with basic video editing (CapCut or similar ‚Äî just combining clips, no advanced editing)

Familiarity with Meta Ads Manager (campaign creation and ad upload)

Extremely detail-oriented and process-driven

Reliable, consistent, and follows SOPs exactly

Strong English communication (written)

IMPORTANT: Fast and stable internet connection (minimum 50 Mbps). You will be uploading and downloading video files daily. Please include a speed test screenshot (speedtest.net) with your application.



This is an ongoing role with consistent daily tasks. If you can follow instructions precisely and deliver on time, we want to hear from you.

title: URGENT: Hiring "AI Influencer" CapCut Video Creator ( Veo3, HeyGen, ElevenLabs, ChatGPT etc. )
description:
Please read the ENTIRE description before applying! :)



Our previous candidate couldn't continue due to personal problems so we're now ONLY looking for VERY dedicated members with experience in CapCut and other AI tools mentioned. This opportunity is seriously much better than it sounds at first glance!







A few words about us:



Hey! We are Organic Media, a micro-agency creating and distributing educational and engaging AI-generated short-form videos for e-commerce brands, mainly in the pet niche.



You‚Äôll work directly with our amazing manager ( 20 years old from Europe, with over 3 years of real experience in this exact space ), who has personally prepared step-by-step tutorials on Loom to teach you everything from the ground up.

No confusion. No guessing. No wasted time. ( Most tea
mbers learned the workflow within a few days and are now working fully independently )







What kind of videos will you create?

Simple UGC-like short-form videos fully based on the provided scripts by us ( you might just need to tweak a few words if needed ) which look realistic and feel "natural" to the viewers on platforms like YouTube Shorts, Instagram or
. Some of them are silently advertising products at the end but the key is that it doesn't sound like an ad but rather a native short-form video which a real person/influencer would record with their iPhone. There are a few styles such as just a calm "sit down" video ( where there's only one image and the influencer would just talk for 2 minutes ) or other ones where there're a few "shots" of them with a few seconds each and the scenes change but it's really not difficult at all - just a few more generations and then connecting them in CapCut.





The process is straightforward:

Getting our scripts ready and approved, using your own creativity and generating high quality base images using tools like Nano Banana Pro, turning these images into video clips using platforms like Veo3, Kling or HeyGen and for voice ElevenLabs, cuts and trimming, other minor adjustments such as background audio effects if needed ( like supermarket background audio ). Whole process is 90% just creating the right images/video clips etc, we might not even do transitions or captions so there won't be much editing skill needed. Everything is shown clearly in the training.



You‚Äôll be creating a lot of videos a day but these are not complex edits AT ALL. Difficulty level: 6/10 ( again, 80% is just generating the rate "input" images and later just animating them with voice. That's it )





Here are visual examples of what the videos look like ( NOT OURS ):

1. 
/reel/DTty7hsAHe_/

2. 
/reel/DT0R9KgDkuW/

3. 
/reel/DSc75hsDQV6/

4. 
/reel/DT8pDFngXfp/

5. 
/reel/DUOAHm3kY7P/



( In your application, let us know your thoughts, do you think you can easily recreate them - what tools would you use and why? )





Training & onboarding ( this is the biggest advantage )

Once hired, you will receive structured video tutorials. In total, we have a few hours available, though most people don‚Äôt need all of it. The workflow is clear so no missing steps and no ‚Äúfigure it out yourself.‚Äù







Daily workload ( important )

You‚Äôll create around 10 to 20+ videos per day ( 1 to 2 min long - we‚Äôll start with a smaller amount and later increase it - won't negatively affect your monthly pay. We just want to make it easier for you to start - ultimately we'll be doing 20+ but making sure it's under 8-10h a day, at first it may take you longer and we may work harder - but once learned it easily becomes manageable ).

In reality, you'd have exactly 4 unique "AI influencers" but all of 4 them have the same scripts to use, you'd just need to change a few words to help with the context ( some of them might be talking only about "dogs" but some about "cats" so just need to change a few words to make it all make sense ) and you could use the same image prompts to generate almost identical images for each influencer. In reality it‚Äôs just 2 to 6 original videos PER INFLUENCER ( 4 of them ) and each with a very similar structure. Once trained, this is very manageable.



Your job is simple:

Create the videos, export them, and send them to us daily on 
.

That‚Äôs it. No posting. No account management. No stress.







Equipment & storage ( we make this easy )

You‚Äôll need a good computer that can smoothly handle 1080p/light 4k video editing ( we‚Äôll do 1080p but we‚Äôre going to work on multiple browser tabs ), a stable internet connection, and at least 16GB of RAM and 250GB+ of fast storage AVAILABLE. 1TB+ of SSD storage is preferred ( make sure it‚Äôs SSD and not old and slow HDD ).



If you need to buy storage/RAM ( for example, a 1TB SSD for around $100 ), we will refund you. This is required ONLY to save you time and speed up your workflow so you can be more efficient since it can be a couple GB of files a day ( you can later remove them after sending them to us. )



There also may be small subscription costs which you‚Äôd have to cover later if needed ( only around $10 a month ) for services like iCloud+ on iPhone/iPad or 
 Nitro - we refund those as well.







Tools & software ( HUGE upside )

You get FREE access to ALL paid tools that cost us hundreds of dollars per month, including:

- AI avatar tools like HeyGen or Veo3,

- Copywriting software like ChatGPT+, Grok or Claude,

- Editing software like CapCut PRO on Desktop,

- and our CUSTOM voice-over tools like ElevenLabs,

We provide logins, instructions, and full support.

( ALL OF THEM ARE WORTH $500+ MONTHLY )





Work environment & communication

You‚Äôll have a private 1:1 chat with our manager and separate one to send your daily work in, work fully remotely through 
, receive clear feedback, and be treated as a long-term tea
mber, not disposable labor.

No stressful interviews. No micromanagement. No slow
s back and forth.







Responsibilities

- Adjust our scripts for the context

- Create videos from start to finish.

- Export and send them.

- Apply feedback and improve.

- Prepare scripts for the next day.

- Organize files properly.

- Communicate clearly.

- Hit deadlines without reminders.

That‚Äôs it. Simple, repetitive, and enjoyable.







This job is perfect for you if

You‚Äôre looking for long-term stability ( months or years ), you‚Äôre willing to learn, tech-savvy, creative, organized, and able to focus consistently. You already have video creation/editing experience. Already done some AI influencers related jobs and have good experience in: Google VEO3, Nano Banana Pro, HeyGen, ElevenLabs, CapCut PRO and other similar tools. Your computer can handle multiple tabs open ( A LOT of them ). You care about doing things properly, understand and speak English well, respond to messages quickly, and can work up to 6 days per week. You‚Äôre a young, talented, smart individual. You‚Äôre okay with a slightly heavier learning phase in the first week, you‚Äôre not afraid to ask questions, you‚Äôre reliable and honest about mistakes, and you either already have or can get an iPhone device ( used only for specific verification codes - refunded if needed. You can even get some used iPhone 8 for like $40 which works ).

We value dedication, reliability, and improvement more than raw talent.







This job is not for you if

You‚Äôre looking for quick money, disappear without communication, can‚Äôt focus, you‚Äôre on the older side and have never edited 1 video in your life, never played with the AI tools mentioned above, your computer can‚Äôt handle having multiple tabs open at the same time, have unstable internet, refuse feedback, rush work carelessly, avoid consistency, or cannot communicate in English.







Salary & payments

This is a full-time position, starting at 6 days per week, under 10 hours per day. ( ultimately under 8h once you become very efficient, which our manager will help you achieve and it won't impact your salary working less - quite the opposite! )



Starting salary ranges from around $440-$540/month based on experience, with the potential in the future to increase to $540+ based on a few factors such as performance, dedication, and quality of work.



Payments are monthly, in any currency or method available in your country. ( we‚Äôll try )



To build trust, we‚Äôre offering to pay you $100 after the first week of working with us, with the remaining balance at month end. ( we already got scammed by other platforms so please respect this )



And remember, we pay $500+ dollars/month for paid tools so you can get them for FREE meaning your pay is actually 100% profit + refunds for any costs of yours. ( meaning in theory your total compensation is closer to $1000+ including tool access )







Hiring process (step-by-step)

- Please re-read this job post carefully and only then submit your application.

- In your job application, make sure to set the right title and answer every point.

- We will review it and reach out with an extra message if accepted.

- We'll send you a Google Form to fill out with contact info, etc.

- You‚Äôll be invited to our 
 server and will get your 1:1 chat.

- You'll complete the training and take notes of it to learn everything.

- We'll give you access to all the tools and refund any required purchases.

- You'll officially start creating videos for Organic Media and get hired.

Simple and effective.







Why this is a real opportunity

No confusion, no guessing, no unpaid trials. You get real structured video training on Loom, real tools, real support, and real long-term growth - including potential promotion to coach or lead roles.

Some jobs may offer to pay more, but very few:

Teach you properly step by step, invest in you, respect your time, and give you paid tools for free.







How to apply (pay attention)

Your application title must start with the first word ‚Äú Influencer ‚Äù:

‚Äú Influencer: (‚Ä¶) ‚Äú

Applications without this will be ignored.





In your application, please include the following:

- Your detailed thoughts on the 5 videos linked above,

- Your past experience ( or none - that‚Äôs fine ),

- Links to any past work or simple edits,

- a detailed introduction about yourself,

- Your daily routine and availability,

- Why you want this opportunity and why we should pick you over someone else. ( why you‚Äôre special )

- and detailed answers to these 15 questions:



1. Do you have experience using CapCut on DESKTOP? How long have you been using it, and what type of videos do you usually create with it?

2. Which AI video tools have you personally used? ( For example: VEO, Kling, Nano Banana Pro, Seedream 4,5, HeyGen, Vozo, etc.) Briefly describe what you used them for.

3. When you watch short-form videos that reuse existing footage, are you able to recognize patterns such as hooks, pacing, avatar placement, and caption timing? Please explain how you notice these patterns.

4. We work with very detailed step-by-step SOPs that specify exactly which clips to use and how to assemble them. How do you typically work when instructions are extremely clear and structured?

5. If you are unsure about a task or something does not match the instructions, what do you do?

6. When generating AI videos, what are the most common problems you run into? (for example: bad lip sync, weird hands, low realism, wrong lighting, artifacts, etc.)

7. Would you say you‚Äôre more of a creative problem-solver who looks for shortcuts, loopholes, or ways around limitations, or someone who prefers to strictly follow rules and structure?

8. Have you ever had to regenerate the same AI scene or just an image multiple times to get a usable result? What usually goes wrong and how do you fix it?

9. When working with AI tools, do you prefer experimenting freely or strictly following a proven workflow? Why?

10. Tell us about your PC specs, how much RAM and Available Storage and is it a PC or laptop/Macbook. Also, do you already have an iPhone/iPad? If so, which model is it/generation?

11. Are you good at learning? Meaning if you want to learn something by for example, watching YouTube tutorials - do you usually rewatch it or take notes? Or just watch it once and try it yourself?

12. Describe exactly how you usually organize your project files when working on multiple videos at the same time.

For example: how you name folders, how you separate drafts vs finals, and how you avoid losing assets.

13. Take a look at the job post once again and find the 5 video example links we've included above. Watch all of them fully and let us know your overall thoughts, how do you think they were created - what tools would you use and why? Please cover the whole process in detail ( these aren't our videos but very similar )

14. What are your long-term plans or goals with this opportunity?

15. To confirm that you‚Äôve read everything carefully, please tell us your favorite meal and dessert, as well as a restaurant in your country. Explain why someone from outside your country should absolutely try it. :)





Do not use ChatGPT or any AI to fully write your application. Be real, honest and detailed. We value spelling mistakes over perfect, AI generated responses. ( Yes, we can detect AI generated responses and it just isn't a good look on you )



You must also follow our Instagram: ( 
/organicxmedia )







Final note

We are hiring ONLY 1 PERSON for this role and are focused strictly on long-term relationships ( months + )

If you are dedicated, reliable, and willing to learn, this can be a very comfortable long-term position. Can‚Äôt wait to have you on - good luck!

title: Senior Accounts Payable Officer
description:
Premium Australian BPO is seeking an experienced Accounts Payable Officer to join the financial team of our Australian client- an engineering, infrastructure and construction services company. 



This full-time (FT) role offers the flexibility of working-from-home (WFH), a market leading salary package and an opportunity for personal and professional growth into the Australian market. The role is a dedicated 40 hours per week- Australian business hours (8am-5pm AEST). 



About the Role:

In this role, you‚Äôll be responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate processing of invoices and payments, maintaining strong relationships with internal stakeholders and suppliers, and contributing to the smooth operation of the company‚Äôs accounts payable function.

You‚Äôll manage day-to-day accounts payable activities, assist with month-end processes, and support ad-hoc finance projects.



Key Responsibilities Include:

‚Ä¢ Process invoices promptly and accurately, ensuring compliance with company policy and statutory requirements.

‚Ä¢ Verify and obtain correct authorizations for all invoices.

‚Ä¢ Assist with new supplier setup and ensure documentation is complete and authorized.

‚Ä¢ Prepare and process weekly and monthly payment runs.

‚Ä¢ Manage and reconcile staff expenses and credit card statements.

‚Ä¢ Respond to queries from internal and external stakeholders in a professional and timely manner.

‚Ä¢ Provide reporting to internal stakeholders as required.

‚Ä¢ Support month-end reconciliations and preparation of schedules.

‚Ä¢ Participate in ad hoc finance projects as needed.



Key Requirements Include: MUST HAVES

‚Ä¢ Minimum 3‚Äì5 years of hands-on accounts payable experience, ideally in a senior capacity.

‚Ä¢ Previous experience working with Australian clients- ideally in similar accounts payable officer role. 

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of AP processes, reconciliations, and payment procedures.

‚Ä¢ High level of proficiency with Microsoft Office (Excel, Word). 

‚Ä¢ Experienced and high level of proficiency with an ERP system.

‚Ä¢ Excellent attention to detail, organisation, and communication skills.

‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently while collaborating remotely with the Australian finance team.

‚Ä¢ Comfortable liaising with stakeholders via
 and phone.

‚Ä¢ High level of proficiency in English both written and verbal. 



Why Apply for this role?

‚Ä¢ Opportunity to work remotely with a respected Australian infrastructure company.

‚Ä¢ Stable, long-term role with a supportive finance team.

‚Ä¢ Chance to contribute to meaningful projects and gain exposure to large-scale operations.



Please Include in your application:

- CV for your application to be considered. Highlight your relevant accounts payable experience and proficiency in ERP systems. 



This role requires applicants have a complete WFH set up in place. Please include information about your set-up including

title: Creative Content Specialist (Part-Time Contractor)
description:
Work Schedule: Flexible, with some overlap during U.S. Eastern Time for coordination



About Create Launch & Profit (CLP)

Create Launch & Profit is a premium course creation and licensing agency that helps experts, service providers, coaches, consultants, and corporate professionals turn their expertise into scalable, high-ticket online courses, academies, certifications, and licensing-ready education assets.

We are authority-led, IP-first, and results-focused. Our positioning is premium, professional, and strategic ‚Äî and our content needs to reflect that.

As we scale, we need a Creative Content Specialist who can take our client work and founder content and turn it into polished, scroll-stopping social media assets that position CLP as a top-tier agency.



Role Overview

We are hiring a Creative Content Specialist to handle video editing, graphic design, content repurposing, and social media posting across
, Instagram, and LinkedIn.

This is not a basic social media VA role.

This is not a role where you just schedule posts someone else created.

You will be responsible for taking raw client work samples, testimonials, video footage, and founder content and creatively showcasing it in multiple formats ‚Äî carousels, reels, case studies, before/afters, walkthroughs, and more.

We have high creative standards. Your edits must be clean, polished, and professional ‚Äî not rushed, templated, or DIY. We want content that feels premium, intentional, and agency-level, like this example.

You'll work alongside our founder and marketing specialist to execute a content strategy that consistently showcases our work and builds our authority.



Key Responsibilities

Video Editing & Content Repurposing



Edit video content (founder reels, client work showcases, behind-the-scenes, testimonials) with clean, polished, professional quality

Repurpose long-form content into short-form assets (Reels, Stories, feed posts) optimized for
, Instagram, and LinkedIn

Use smooth transitions, strategic B-roll, on-brand graphics, and cohesive color grading

Ensure all video content is platform-optimized (vertical format, captions for sound-off viewing, proper aspect ratios)



Graphic Design & Visual Content Creation



Design high-quality graphics including:



Client testimonial posts

Before/after course dashboards

"Here's what we built" carousels

Case study one-pagers

Process breakdowns and educational posts





Maintain brand consistency using provided templates, colors, fonts, and logo

Create visuals that feel premium, strategic, and scroll-stopping



Social Media Posting & Scheduling



Schedule and post content across
, Instagram, and LinkedIn (priority order)

Execute captions provided by the founder or marketing team using our GPT system

Ensure all posts go live accurately and on time per the content calendar



Creative Strategy & Execution



Think creatively about how to showcase client work in multiple formats

Pitch new ideas for displaying our work that we may not have thought of

Take initiative to improve content quality and visual storytelling without micromanagement





What Success Looks Like

? Content is posted consistently across all platforms on schedule

? Every piece of content feels premium, polished, and intentional ‚Äî not rushed or generic

? Client work is showcased creatively in multiple formats (carousels, reels, case studies, testimonials)

? Video edits are smooth, professional, and on-brand

? Graphics are clean, strategic, and aligned with CLP's authority-led positioning

? The founder and marketing specialist can trust you to execute without constant oversight

? Deadlines are consistently met



Required Skills & Experience

Must-Have:

? Proven experience in video editing for social media (Instagram Reels,
, LinkedIn)

? Strong graphic design skills (Canva minimum; Adobe Suite is a bonus)

? Portfolio showcasing premium, professional work ‚Äî we want to see clean edits, polished graphics, and creative execution

? Experience creating content for agencies, professional brands, or marketing-focused businesses (preferred)

? Ability to work 10 hours per week with some flexibility for U.S. Eastern Time coordination

? Strong attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines consistently

? Self-starter who can execute independently without constant direction

Preferred (Nice to Have):



Experience in the course creation, education, or online business industry

Familiarity with GoHighLevel or CRM/marketing platforms

Experience repurposing long-form content into multiple short-form assets

Understanding of platform-specific content strategies 
 vs. Instagram vs. LinkedIn)





Tools & Systems

You'll use:



Video editing software of your choice (CapCut, Adobe Premiere, Final Cut, Descript, etc.) ‚Äî whatever gets premium results

Graphic design tools (Canva, Adobe Suite, or similar)

Social media scheduling tools (Meta Business Suite, Later, Metricool, or similar)

Brand templates, content calendar, and captions provided by CLP team





What This Role Is NOT

? This is not a basic VA role

? You will not be writing captions or copy (we provide those)

? You will not be managing comments, DMs, or engagement (not required at this time)

? You will not be tracking analytics or reporting (just create and post)

? This is not a role for templated, generic, or rushed content



Deal-Breakers

We will immediately reject candidates who:

? Do not have a portfolio showcasing premium, professional work

? Consistently miss deadlines or fail to stick to timelines

? Produce low-quality, rushed, or unprofessional edits



Work Structure



Part-time contractor: 10 hours per week

Compensation: $400/month

Remote: Philippines-based preferred

Schedule: Flexible, with some overlap during U.S. Eastern Time for coordination and feedback





How to Apply

To apply, submit:



Your portfolio ‚Äî Must include:



Video editing samples (Reels, short-form content, social media edits)

Graphic design samples (carousels, testimonials, case studies, or similar)

Examples of work for agencies, professional brands, or marketing-focused businesses (preferred)





A brief introduction (3‚Äì5 sentences) explaining:



Your experience with video editing and graphic design for social media

Why you're a good fit for this role

One example of how you've creatively showcased client work or results





Answer this question:

"What's one creative way you would display a client's before/after course dashboard on Instagram to make it scroll-stopping and premium?"





Applications without a portfolio or without answering the creative question will not be considered.



Final Notes

We're looking for someone who:



Takes pride in producing high-quality, polished work

Thinks creatively about how to showcase our client work

Executes consistently and meets deadlines

Doesn't need constant oversight to deliver premium results



If that's you, we'd love to see your work.

title: Graphic Designer - Print File Preparation Specialist
description:
About Us

This role works across two established Australian print brands:



DTF Direct - A leading provider of direct-to-film printing for custom apparel and textiles.

The Tshirt Mill - Specialising in high-quality custom printed garments for businesses, brands and events.



We are fast-paced, production-driven businesses with high standards. Accuracy and efficiency matter here. Your work directly impacts print quality and turnaround times.



When applying, please include the word ‚ÄúPrecision‚Äù in the first line of your application. Applicants who don't do this will not be reviewed. 



About the Role

We are looking for a highly accurate, efficient and dependable Graphic Designer to prepare print-ready files daily.

This is not a conceptual design role. It is a production-focused role that requires precision, consistency, and speed.

Your core responsibility is ensuring every file is 100 per cent correct before it reaches production.

Why Join Us



We value long-term tea
mbers and treat our staff with respect. This is a stable, full-time role with consistent hours and clear expectations.



We offer:

Paid annual leave

Paid public holidays

You must be:

FAST - Deadlines and accuracy matter 

Extremely detail-oriented

Comfortable working with high daily file volumes

Confident working independently

Proactive in spotting and fixing artwork issues



Key Responsibilities

Prepare print-ready files for DTF printing, including adding white channels, resizing and resolution checks

Create garment mockups with correct sizing and placement guides

Set up accurate print dimensions for front, back and sleeve placements

Ensure Pantone colour matching where required

Double-check all artwork against order specifications

Identify and fix artwork issues before production

Maintain organised file structures and naming conventions

Communicate clearly with production staff, including updates on workload 



What We‚Äôre Looking For

Strong Illustrator skills



Excellent understanding of print resolution, colour modes and file preparation



Highly organised workflow habits



Ability to manage multiple jobs daily without sacrificing accuracy

Experience in DTF printing, garment decoration or screen printing

title: VFX / Visual Impact Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video
description:
VFX / Visual Impact Editor - Lethal Luxury Short-Form Video



Brand: Prismiera (Luxury Jewelry)

Pay: $1100 USD/month

Type: Full-time, 40 hours/week

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Software: Premiere Pro + After Effects (mandatory)



---



The Mission



Prismiera is a pre-launch luxury jewelry brand launching a short-form video series - 35‚Äì50 second stories about mythology, history, spies, poisoners, queens, alchemists, and other on-brand topics posted across TikTok, Reels, and YouTube Shorts.



The aesthetic is History and mythology meets high fashion. The editing energy leans closer to a perfectly-timed After Effects edit / storytelling than a corporate product video. (You have an eye for aesthetics and cinematography)



You will receive a script, a voiceover file, and a mood reference. Your job is to build the scene from nothing: generate AI visuals, voiceovers, source archival footage, layer sound design, and deliver a short where every second earns the next. A visual storyteller. (We provide access to the frontier generation models)



---



The Style



YES: Dark luxury. Museum. AE VFX edit. Stylish/Lethal. Fun. Rich textures. Clean typography. Controlled palette. Both silence and impact used with intention.



NO: CapCut default presets. Anything that looks like a stock photo slideshow or a corporate deck.



You understand that more effects does not necessarily mean better. Every cut has a reason.



---



Core Skills (Non-Negotiables)



Motion Graphics - You can build scenes, transitions, and visual elements from scratch in After Effects - not just cut footage.



Voiceover-First Storytelling - You are editing to a narration primarily, music track second. You know when to let a line breathe and when to accelerate. You never bury the script's punchline under a flashy transition. The voice leads - the visuals serve.



Retention Instinct - You understand that the first frame is an ad for the second frame. You know what stops a scroll. You build hooks visually, not just with text overlays. Every 2‚Äì3 seconds, something changes.



Rhythm & Beat-Sync - You can sync cuts, zooms, and effects to music. You understand "the drop." If you've made AMVs, fan/anime edits, or phonk edits, you already have this skill - we want you to apply it with restraint.



AI-Assisted Asset Creation - You are comfortable generating images and short clips using tools like Midjourney or Kling. (We usually move onto new tools as soon as they are released). You treat AI as a production tool, not a novelty. We provide all paid accounts - you bring the creative judgment.



---



Bonus Skills (Not Required, But We'll Notice)



- After Effects compositing - Mocha tracking, light matching (future projects will involve product placement in video scenes)

- Typography sense - fonts that feel intentional, never default

- Color grading - pushing AI output and footage into a consistent palette

- Sound design beyond music - layering SFX on movement, crafting risers and hits



---



Weekly Output



Ramp-up (first 2‚Äì3 weeks): 2‚Äì3 shorts as you learn the brand voice and pipeline.

Steady state: 4‚Äì5 shorts per week at the locked quality standard.



You will work from clear creative briefs with reference scripts, mood boards, and audio clips for most batches.



---



How to Apply



Do not send a generic cover letter.

Use 7 apply points or more when applying.



Subject line: Lethal Editor - [Your name]



Send the following (in this order):



1. The Story Test. Link to ONE short-form video you edited that includes voiceover or spoken dialogue. We need to see that you can pace visuals to a script.



2. The AE Style Test. Link to ONE video that shows your visual rhythm and editing craft - an AMV, fan edit, fashion reel, or anything where the editing itself is the skill. It doesn't need to be "dark" or "luxury." It needs to show us how you think about pacing and impact.



3. AI Experience (1 sentence). What is your experience level with generative AI tools (Midjourney, seedream, Kling, etc.)? If none, say so - we'll evaluate the rest of your application on its own merits.



4. Hardware. Your PC specs: CPU / GPU / RAM. Plus your internet upload speed.



5. Turnaround Estimate. How long does a 30‚Äì50 second high-quality short typically take you, start to finish?



6. The Rewrite. Rewrite this sentence to sound dark, powerful, and modern: "She is really cool and strong and she wins."



---



Paid Trial (Shortlisted Candidates)



Before any full-time commitment, we run a weekly paid trial. We provide real scripts and style references. You deliver 30‚Äì50 second shorts. Trial is compensated at $250 USD at the end of each week (after work). If it's a mutual fit after 30 days, we transition to $550 USD payments every 2 weeks (before work).



This protects both of us - you see whether the work fits your strengths, we see whether the output fits our brand.



---



What We Offer



- Paid accounts for all frontier AI tools; seedance2.0, seedream5.0, etc.

- Creative identity - you're building the visual identity of a brand from launch, not filling someone else's template

- Clear briefs - most, if not every batch comes with scripts, audio files, mood boards, and specific reference videos

title: Bookeeper - Xero Specialist
description:
About the Role:

This role provides high?accuracy bookkeeping and financial administration support across the New Zealand Honey Group, working across multiple Xero files for a growing FMCG/e?commerce business. You will manage accounts payable, accounts receivable, and weekly bank reconciliations in Xero, ensuring all financial data across the group is clean, timely, and audit?ready.



 The work requires strong technical capability in Xero, confidence with digital document?capture tools, and a meticulous approach to detail. You will support smooth financial operations by keeping records up to date, resolving discrepancies, and maintaining clear communication with internal teams and suppliers.





Key Responsibilities:

Accounts Payable:

Timely processing of supplier invoices through Xero with accurate coding, tracking and documentation.

Match invoices and bank feed transactions to purchase orders and receipts where applicable.

Maintain up?to?date AP schedules.

Follow up on missing invoices, statements, or documentation.

Ensure GST treatment is correct and compliant.

Accounts Receivable:

Generate and send customer invoices as required.

Import completed sales from CIN7 daily.

Reconcile payments received and allocated correctly.

Monitor overdue accounts and send reminders or statements.

Maintain accurate customer records and resolve discrepancies.

Bank Reconciliation & Financial Accuracy

Complete weekly bank reconciliations to a high standard.

Investigate and resolve coding issues, duplicates, or mismatches.

Reconcile credit card, PayPal, Amazon, and other payment gateways.

Maintain clean, accurate ledgers and support month?end processes.

Systems & Workflow Support:

Use Xero and/or Hubdoc for document capture and ensure all supporting documents are filed correctly.

Work within ApprovalMax workflows (if applicable) to support invoice approvals.

Assist with CIN7?related financial tasks such as matching POs, stock invoices, or landed cost entries (if applicable).

Identify opportunities to streamline processes or improve accuracy.

Communication & Administration:

Communicate with suppliers regarding statements, credits, and payment queries.

Liaise with internal teams to clarify coding, approvals, or missing information.

Maintain confidentiality and handle financial information with care.

Support ad hoc finance administration tasks as required.



About You:

Strong experience in bookkeeping with proven capability in Xero. 3+ years Xero experience as an administrator.

Good Excel skills, including the ability to complete manual Amazon reconciliations accurately, with instruction

Experience with ApprovalMax, Hubdoc and/or CIN7 is a significant advantage.

Very high level of accuracy, attention to detail, and consistency in financial data entry.

Confident managing AP, AR, and reconciliations independently.

Strong organisational skills and ability to manage workload across the week.

Clear communicator who can follow processes and ask questions when needed.

Comfortable working remotely with digital tools and cloud?based systems.

Extremely high level of confidentiality and professionalism when handling financial information.



Role is: 

6am to 11am Phillipines time - Monday to Friday

title: Dynamic Customer Service Specialist in Logistics
description:
Company Overview:

Recur is a logistics company based in New Zealand. We are committed to providing top-quality service to our customers by focusing on operational excellence and maintaining a positive work environment for our employees. We are currently hiring for a Customer Service to join our team.



Company Culture and Values:

We offer a competitive salary package, but what sets us apart is our commitment to job security. Our company has a long-standing reputation for stability and we prioritize providing our employees with a secure and stable working environment.



In addition to job security, we also value career growth and advancement. We provide our employees with opportunities to develop their skills and expertise through ongoing training and development programs. We believe in promoting from within and providing our tea
mbers with a clear path for career advancement and promotions.



We understand the importance of a safe and healthy working environment. Our company prioritizes the health and wellbeing of our employees and we go to great lengths to ensure this.



Job Description:

As a Customer Service Specialist, you will be responsible for managing and coordinating our fleet of trucks and drivers to ensure timely deliveries and pickups while maintaining accurate records. You will be responsible for dispatching and planning trucks and drivers, monitoring drivers' progress, and communicating with customers regarding any delays or issues. In addition, you will be responsible for providing excellent customer service to clients and vendors.



Responsibilities:



- Dispatching and Planning trucks and drivers to ensure timely and efficient delivery of goods

- Monitoring drivers' progress and communicating with customers regarding any delays or issues

- Communicating with drivers regarding any route changes or issues that may arise during their trips

- Providing excellent customer service to clients and vendors

- Other duties as assigned



Qualifications:



- Exceptional analytical skills with a passion for problem-solving

- Strong analytical and critical thinking skills

- Ability to work independently, think creatively, and develop innovative solutions to complex problems



Career Growth and Development:

At Recur, we believe in supporting and encouraging our employees to take on new challenges and grow within their role. We provide our employees with a supportive environment that encourages them to push their limits, expand their skills, and take on leadership roles within the company. As a long-term goal, we want our applicants to take on a leadership role, train others, and manage a team.



Compensation & Hours:

The working hours will be from 2am-1pm PHT (11 hours), Monday - Friday, which should be a good fit for you. Paid overtime weekends are also available. We provide a highly competitive compensation package that includes a salary commensurate with your level of experience. Additionally, we offer a performance-based Christmas Bonus to recognize and reward outstanding contributions to our team's success.



To apply, please click the link below.


/hgTOkO4q4kwB5UKHl8xp



We look forward to welcoming a driven and motivated individual to our team who shares our values and vision.

title: Video Editor
description:
About the Role



We‚Äôre looking for a full-time remote Video Editor to become the editing backbone of the Laura Higgins content machine. You‚Äôll take raw footage and turn it into polished, high-performing content across YouTube, Instagram, podcast, and ads - consistently, on time, and at a standard that makes people stop scrolling.



This is not a ‚Äúchop up some clips‚Äù role. You‚Äôll be editing long-form YouTube videos, short-form social content, full podcast episodes with video, and ad creatives - all for a brand that‚Äôs growing fast and needs someone who can keep up. You‚Äôll work closely with our Creative Content Manager and directly contribute to content that reaches thousands of creative business owners every week.



What You‚Äôll Actually Do:



1. YouTube Long-Form Editing

- Edit 1‚Äì2 long-form YouTube videos per week (8‚Äì20 minutes) from raw footage to final export

 - Build in retention-driving elements: pattern breaks, B-roll cuts, text overlays, zoom transitions, and visual pacing that keeps viewers watching

- Add captions, lower thirds, and on-screen graphics that match our bold, clean brand style

- Work from scripts and run sheets to ensure the final edit delivers on the video‚Äôs strategic intent

- Implement feedback quickly and maintain version control across all edits



2. Short-Form Social Content

- Edit 7‚Äì10+ short-form videos per week (Reels, Shorts, TikToks) from existing long-form footage and dedicated shoots

 -Hook-first editing - the first 1‚Äì2 seconds must stop the scroll every time

 -Add captions (animated/styled), trending audio where relevant, and platform-optimised formatting

 -Adapt content for each platform‚Äôs native format and best practices



3. Podcast Editing

- Edit 1 podcast episode every two weeks.

- Clean audio, balance levels, remove dead air and filler while maintaining natural conversational flow

- Add visual elements: speaker labels, topic transitions, key quote highlights, and chapter markers

- Pull 3‚Äì5 highlight clips per episode for social repurposing



4. Ad Creatives (As Needed)

- Edit ad creatives following our proven structures (hook ? agitate ? pivot ? value ? CTA)

- Create multiple variations of hooks and CTAs for testing

- Quick turnarounds - ad creatives often need 24‚Äì48 hour delivery



5. Organisation & Workflow

- Upload all final exports and project files to Google Drive in our folder structure

- Update ClickUp tasks with status, delivery links, and notes

- Maintain clear file naming conventions and organised project folders

- Communicate proactively via Slack - flag blockers early, confirm receipt of briefs, share progress



Weekly Deliverables

- Long-form YouTube videos edited and delivered (1 per week)

- Short-form social videos (Reels / Shorts / TikTok) (5‚Äì8+ per week)

- Podcast episodes edited (audio) (1 every two weeks)

- Ad creatives (when briefed)

- As needed, 24‚Äì48hr turnaround



Tools & Tech



Video Editing: Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve preferred. Open to your tool of choice if output quality is there.

Audio Editing: Descript, Audition, DaVinci Fairlight, or equivalent

Captions / Graphics: CapCut (for quick social), After Effects or Canva (for graphics/motion)

Project Management: ClickUp  -  all tasks, briefs, deadlines, and feedback live here

File Storage: Google Drive  -  all raw footage, exports, and assets

Communication: Slack  -  daily async communication with the team





What You‚Äôll Bring

- 4+ years of professional video editing experience (personal brand, coaching, education, or marketing content strongly preferred)

- Proven portfolio or showreel showing long-form editing, short-form social content, AND audio/podcast work

- Strong proficiency in Premiere Pro or DaVinci Resolve (we‚Äôre flexible on your primary tool, but you must deliver professional-grade output)

- Excellent audio editing skills  -  you can balance levels, remove noise, clean dialogue, and make a conversation sound polished without sounding robotic

- Fluent in English (written and spoken)  -  you‚Äôll be communicating daily with our team via Slack and ClickUp

- Reliable high-speed internet and a computer capable of editing 4K footage without bottlenecks

- Available for 4+ hours of overlap with AEST (Australian Eastern Standard Time) business hours for communication, feedback, and real-time collaboration

- Self-managing and deadline-driven  -  you don‚Äôt need to be chased. You own your deliverables and communicate proactively.



Bonus (Not Required, But Will Set You Apart)

- Experience with motion graphics or After Effects

- Thumbnail design capability (Photoshop / Canva)

- Understanding of YouTube retention mechanics (pacing, pattern breaks, hook editing)

- Experience editing for a personal brand, coach, or course creator

 -Familiarity with ClickUp, Google Drive workflows, and async remote teams

 -You genuinely consume content about business, marketing, or personal development  -  you get the world we operate in



Working Hours & Time Zone

This is a full-time remote contractor role (35‚Äì40 hours per week). You‚Äôll manage your own schedule with two requirements:

- Minimum 4 hours daily overlap with 9am‚Äì5pm AEST (UTC+10/+11) for real-time communication, feedback rounds, and team syncs

- All deliverables met on time per the weekly schedule  -  we care about output, not when you‚Äôre sitting at your desk



We work async-first with Slack and ClickUp. You‚Äôll have a weekly check-in with Sam (Creative Content Manager) and be expected to share your Big 3 priorities each week so the team knows what‚Äôs in progress.



How to Apply



?? Read This Carefully

Your application must include ALL of the following elements. Incomplete applications will not be reviewed.



1. Send a single
 to 
 with the following: Subject line: "VIDEO EDITOR  -  [Your Full Name]  -  [Your City, Country]"

2. A 3-minute Loom video (maximum, not longer) where you answer these four questions on camera:

--Who are you and where are you based?

--Walk us through one project you‚Äôre most proud of  -  what was the brief, what did you do, and what was the result?

--What does ‚Äúgreat editing‚Äù mean to you? Give a specific example.

--Why do you want to work with Laura Higgins specifically  -  not just any brand?

3. Your portfolio or showreel link  -  must include at least one example of each: long-form video edit, short-form social edit, and podcast/audio edit

4. Your CV / resume as a PDF attachment

5. Your rate expectations (USD per month for 35‚Äì40 hours/week)

6. Your available daily overlap hours with AEST (e.g., ‚ÄúI can overlap 10am‚Äì2pm AEST daily‚Äù)

7. Complete this form:

title: Credit Repair Specialist VA
description:
READ THIS ENTIRE POST BEFORE APPLYING. If you don't follow the instructions at the bottom, your application will be ignored.

We're a fast-growing business credit and funding consultancy helping entrepreneurs access $50K‚Äì$150K in business funding. We're looking for a reliable Credit Repair Specialist VA to join the team on a per-task basis.

We provide training on our systems, templates, and processes. However, you must have prior experience working at a credit repair company. Never worked in credit repair before? This isn't the right fit.

What You'll Be Doing

There are two distinct task types.

Credit Repair ‚Äî You'll execute dispute letters using our pre-built templates and attack flow, submitting disputes through the CFPB. Everything gets notated in the system as you go. Our system tells you exactly what to do.

File Prep ‚Äî You'll clean up client files for funding by removing old inquiries, addresses, names, and employment history using our templates. When needed, you'll make follow-up calls to remove inquiries within 72 hours. Everything gets notated.

Compensation & Growth

This role is per task. Rates are as follows:

Credit Repair Client ‚Äî $20 per client

File Prep (standard inquiry removal, addresses, names, employment) ‚Äî $10 per file

Expedited Inquiry Removal (follow-up call to remove within 72 hours) ‚Äî $20 per client

This role starts per task. As you prove your work and reliability, you transition into a full-time hourly position at $4‚Äì$5 per hour based on performance. From there, top performers get the opportunity to learn the funding side of the business‚Äîwhich comes with bonus opportunities on top of your base rate.

This is a real opportunity with a clear path forward.

Who We're Looking For

Must have prior experience working at a credit repair company. Familiar with Credit Repair Cloud or similar software. Detail-oriented, follows systems precisely, reliable, and communicates clearly.

How to Apply

All of the following are required or your application will not be reviewed:

Use "Paper Route Ready - [Your Name]" as your subject line

Tell us in 2‚Äì3 sentences about your experience working at a credit repair company

What software have you used? (Credit Repair Cloud, DisputeBee, etc.)

What is the difference between CFPB and an FTC report?

How many clients were you managing at a time at your last credit repair job?

What's your availability and time zone?

Why are you looking for a new opportunity right now?

Applications that don't follow these instructions exactly will be deleted.

title: Social Media Manager
description:
We are seeking an experienced Social Media & Marketing Manager, responsible for managing all digital marketing and social media activity for our group of business - with the primary focus being on our Transportable business.



This role is outcome-driven and suited to someone who can independently plan, execute and optimise marketing campaigns while actively managing and converting social media enquiries. In addition to a base contractor rate, commission-based incentives will apply for qualified and converted leads.



Key Responsibilities

Social Media & Content Management



Manage all social media platforms including
, Instagram, TikTok, LinkedIn and relevant marketplace channels.



Create, schedule and publish engaging, high-quality content tailored to the New Zealand housing market.



Ensure consistent branding, tone and messaging across all platforms.



Develop short-form video, posts, reels and stories showcasing transportable homes, builds and promotions.



Marketing & Lead Generation



Develop and execute organic and paid social media marketing campaigns.



Manage paid advertising budgets, targeting, testing and optimisation.



Drive enquiry volume and improve lead quality through data-led marketing decisions.



Enquiry Management & Sales Support



Respond promptly and professionally to all social media and digital enquiries.



Qualify leads, provide accurate product information and pricing guidance.



Pass qualified leads to the sales team and support follow-up where required.



Track enquiry sources, engagement and outcomes.



Reporting & Performance



Provide regular performance updates covering reach, engagement, enquiries and conversions.



Monitor campaign effectiveness and refine strategy to maximise ROI.



Commission-Based Incentives



In addition to the agreed contractor rate, commission will be paid on:



Qualified leads that progress to confirmed sales; or



Sales directly attributable to social media and digital marketing activity.



Commission structure and payment terms will be agreed prior to engagement and aligned with measurable outcomes.



Skills & Experience



Essential



Demonstrated experience managing social media and digital marketing campaigns.



Strong understanding of paid and organic social media strategies.



Excellent written communication skills and customer-focused approach.



Experience handling online enquiries and converting interest into leads.



Preferred



Experience in property, construction, transportable or modular housing.

Experience using CRM or lead-tracking systems.



Good understanding of the New Zealand market and buyer behaviour.

title: Project Manager
description:
We are looking for a Project Manager with a Quality Analyst background who can lead projects with a strong focus on process quality, consistency, and continuous improvement. This role is ideal for someone who has worked in QA and is ready to manage timelines, stakeholders, and delivery standards.



Key Responsibilities

- Plan, manage, and track projects from initiation to completion

- Define quality standards, acceptance criteria, and success metrics for each project

- Ensure project deliverables meet quality benchmarks before final release

- Identify risks, defects, and process gaps early and implement corrective actions

- Coordinate with cross-functional teams to maintain quality and timeline alignment

- Conduct quality reviews, audits, and performance evaluations during project phases

- Maintain project documentation, reports, and quality checklists

- Drive continuous process improvement across teams and workflows



Qualifications

- 2‚Äì4+ years of experience as a Quality Analyst or in a QA role

- 1‚Äì2+ years of project coordination or project management experience

- Strong understanding of QA frameworks, metrics, and review processes

- Experience using project management tools (ClickUp, Asana, Jira, Trello, Monday, or similar)

- High attention to detail and strong analytical skills

- Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills

- Ability to manage multiple projects while maintaining quality standards



Nice to Have

- Experience in process improvement or operational excellence

- Familiarity with Agile, Scrum, or Lean methodologies

- Experience creating SOPs, QA checklists, and audit documentation

- Background in remote or cross-functional team environments



Why This Role Matters



This role ensures that projects are delivered on time and at a high standard of quality. Your QA background gives you the edge to spot issues early, protect quality, and improve systems, not just manage timelines.



How to Apply



Interested candidates may apply by submitting their updated resume.

Please highlight your Quality Analyst experience and any project or process ownership responsibilities.



Shortlisted applicants will be contacted for the next steps.

title: AI Automation Specialist ‚Äì Australian Chinese Law Firm
description:
Location: Remote

Type: Casual/Permanent

Salary Range: $1,100-1,800 AUD/month 

 

Our Vision (This Is What You're Building)



The Dream Workflow:

1. Lawyer uploads a voice recording from a client consultation (30-60 minutes)

2. AI system automatically transcribes the conversation

3. AI extracts key information (names, dates, case type, facts, legal issues)

4. AI generates all required documents using our precedents and templates: 

  Engagement letter

  Client questionnaires

  Retainer agreement

  Court filings

  Affidavits

  Correspondence letters

  Case summary memo

5. All documents are organized into the correct folder structure, named properly, and ready for lawyer review

6. Lawyer spends 10 minutes reviewing instead of 3 hours drafting



We need someone who can turn this vision into reality.

 

What You'll Build



Phase 1: Voice-to-Text Pipeline

‚Ä¢ Integration with Whisper API, AssemblyAI, or similar transcription services

‚Ä¢ Speaker diarization (identifying who said what - lawyer vs. client)

‚Ä¢ Timestamp extraction for key moments

‚Ä¢ Quality checking and error handling for poor audio

Phase 2: AI Document Generation Engine

‚Ä¢ Claude API integration for intelligent document drafting

‚Ä¢ Prompt engineering to extract legal information from transcripts

‚Ä¢ Template-based document generation using our precedents

‚Ä¢ Multi-document workflows (generating 5-10 documents from one consultation)

Phase 3: Smart Organization System

‚Ä¢ Automated folder creation based on case type

‚Ä¢ Follows document naming conventions (e.g., "Case 5834_Li_EngagementLetter.docx")

‚Ä¢ Integration with case management software or OneDrive structure

‚Ä¢ Metadata tagging for easy searching

Phase 4: Quality Control & Human Review

‚Ä¢ Dashboard showing which documents need lawyer review

‚Ä¢ Version control for edited documents

‚Ä¢ Error alerts when AI can't extract required information or complete task (your automations must alert us when something breaks, not fail silently)

 

Required Skills (We Will Test You On These)

Must Have:

‚Ä¢ Advanced Make.com or Zapier expertise - Multi-step workflows with 15+ actions, conditional logic, loops, and error handlers

‚Ä¢ AI API integration experience - You must have actually worked with Anthropic Claude API, or similar. We will ask for examples.

‚Ä¢ Voice/Audio processing - Experience with integrating Whisper API, AssemblyAI, or Rev AI into a larger automated workflow for transcription

‚Ä¢ Document generation automation - Creating Word/PDF documents from templates using AI-generated content

‚Ä¢ Google Workspace or Microsoft 365 automation - Advanced Word/OneDrive manipulation

‚Ä¢ Prompt engineering - You understand how to write prompts that reliably extract structured data from unstructured conversations and integrate built-in prompts that the AI will retain



Bonus Points:

‚Ä¢ Experience with legal documents or legal tech

‚Ä¢ Python/JavaScript for custom integrations

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of ActionStep or other database tools for case management



How to Apply


: 



Your application MUST include:

1. Proof of AI Automation Experience

  Screenshots or Loom video of AI-powered workflows you've built

  Examples must show: API calls, data transformation, document generation

  Generic Zapier workflows (like "Gmail to Slack") don't count



2. Answer This Scenario (Be Specific):

"A lawyer uploads a 45-minute MP3 file of a client consultation about a contract dispute. Your system needs to:

 Transcribe the audio

 Extract: client name, opposing party, contract date, breach details

 Generate: engagement letter, retainer agreement, demand letter or other documents specified by lawyer in the audio

 Save everything to a folder named 'ClientName_ContractDispute_2024'

Walk me through:

 Which specific tools/APIs you would use for each step

 How you would handle errors (bad audio, missing information)

 How you would format the AI prompts to extract legal information

 How you would ensure document quality is good enough for lawyer review"



3. Portfolio Requirements:

 What timezone can you work in?

 Have you used AI APIs before? Which ones?



What We Offer

‚Ä¢ Casual or long-term position ‚Äì You‚Äôll work with a growing law firm

‚Ä¢ Cutting-edge tech - You'll work with the latest AI tools and APIs

‚Ä¢ Autonomy - We'll tell you what we need; you design how to build it



Why This Role Is Different



Most VA jobs are about doing repetitive tasks faster. This role is about eliminating repetitive tasks entirely.

If you've ever thought "There has to be a better way than doing this manually" - this job is for you.

If you get excited about making AI do the boring work so humans can focus on strategy - this job is for you.

If you want to build something that actually matters and saves lawyers hundreds of hours per month - apply now.

 

We're not looking for the cheapest hire. We're looking for the right hire. If you're a true AI automation expert, prove it in your application.

title: Client Success, Program Delivery & Business Operations (Part-Time, Remote | Australia)
description:
Eco Love Wellness is an online health and wellness business dedicated to running holistic health programs for women. We provide accessible and effective support for women struggling with health issues, empowering them to understand their bodies and actively address the root causes of their symptoms through a comprehensive, individualised approach to healing.



We‚Äôre growing and we‚Äôre looking for a highly organised, proactive operator to help keep the engine running.

This isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúbasic VA‚Äù role. You‚Äôll be owning client success, program delivery and the behind-the-scenes systems that keep everything consistent.



Our Core Values:

-Holistic Health: addressing root causes from both biochemical and emotional standpoints

-Transformation: creating space for growth within our community of clients 

-Empowerment: providing knowledge and tools for self-efficacy and independence

-Self-Love: encouraging self-care out of appreciation

-Evidence-Based Approach: guided by data and scientific research

-Impact and Value: making a significant impact and over-delivering on value

-Community: building a strong, supportive community

-Efficiency: working smarter, not harder

-Gratitude: always expressing thankfulness

- AI-first drafting support where needed, w
