title: Lead Generator
description:
About Gutter Guard PRO:

Gutter Guard PRO is a fast-growing exterior maintenance company operating across North America. We work with homeowners and property managers to provide gutter cleaning and gutter guard installation services that deliver long-term protection against water damage, foundation issues, and costly repairs.

We are expanding our commercial division and are looking for motivated Lead Generators to help introduce our services to property management companies and condominium corporations throughout Canada and the United States.



Position Overview:

- This role focuses on outbound cold calling to property management companies to introduce our annual gutter cleaning service and identify potential working relationships.

- You will not be closing sales. Your responsibility is to start conversations, build rapport, and gather contact information so our sales team can follow up.

- This is a professional B2B calling role. Strong communication skills and confidence on the phone are essential.



Responsibilities:

- Make outbound cold calls to property management companies and condominium corporations

- Introduce our services using a provided script (with flexibility to adapt naturally)

- Build rapport with decision-makers and gatekeepers

- Identify interest and gather accurate contact information

- Submit lead details through a Google Form after conversations

- Maintain consistent call activity throughout scheduled work hours

- Represent the company professionally on every call



Compensation:

- Hourly Pay: $3 to $5 USD per hour (based on experience)

- Bonus: $10 USD per qualified lead

- Paid training provided

- There is strong potential for performance-based raises and advancement opportunities. Top performers may be promoted into sales roles with significantly higher salaries.



Work Schedule:

- Full-Time: 40 hours per week

- Part-Time: 20 hours per week available

- Monday to Friday only

- 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM Eastern Time

- 1 hour unpaid break (flexible timing)

- North American holidays observed

- Flexible unpaid time off available with advance notice.



Requirements:

- Fluent English with strong verbal communication skills

- Confident and professional speaking voice

- Comfortable making cold calls for extended periods

- Reliable high-speed internet connection

- Quiet, noise-free workspace

- Quality headset with microphone

- Computer capable of running VoIP software

- Previous cold calling or sales experience is a plus but not required.



Tools Provided:

- Company calling system (RingCentral)

- Scripts and training materials

- Lead submission system

- Ongoing support and coaching



Who We Are Looking For:

- We are looking for individuals who:

- Are confident speaking with professionals

- Are not afraid of rejection

- Can stay motivated while making cold calls

- Have a positive and persistent mindset

- Want to grow into higher-level sales roles over time

- This role is ideal for someone who wants long-term stability and career growth in sales.



How to Apply (Important):

To be considered, you must complete all steps below:

- Submit your application through OnlineJobs.ph

- Attach a short video recording to your application that includes you describing your sales or phone experience as well as reading the following script: ‚ÄúHello, my name is [Your Name], and I‚Äôm calling from Gutter Guard PRO. We work with property management companies to provide annual gutter cleaning services for residential buildings and condominiums. I was hoping to speak with the person responsible for building maintenance to introduce our services and see if this might be helpful for your properties.‚Äù

-Applicants who do not submit a video will not be considered.



If you are motivated, reliable, and ready to grow with a North American company, we would love to hear from you. Feel free to check out our website for more information - 
.

mbers and clients.



Preferred Attributes

title: E-commerce Marketplace & Growth Director (head of)
description:
Reports to: CEO

Location: Remote (Philippines)

Employment Type: Full Time

Work Hours: 4PM ‚Äì 12AM Manila time (EU overlap)

Rate: $2,000/month base (depending on experience)



About Onebird



Onebird is a Dutch marketplace e-commerce company selling exclusively on 
. We operate multiple fast-growing brands and generate millions in annual revenue. Our ambition: become a top 5 seller on 
 within 3 years by building a scalable and dominant structure.



The role



We are not looking for a manager. We are looking for a commercial builder.



As Marketplace & Growth Director, You own topline performance on [
](
) and execute growth within the strategic direction set by the CEO. You own revenue growth, ranking, review acceleration, conversion, pricing, promotions, Customer Experience (CX), affiliate growth, and overall 
 account strategy. You report directly to the CEO.



**Scope guardrails:** everything you do must increase 
 revenue. No webshop initiatives. 





Phase 1 ‚Äì First 90 days: understand, execute, and build



You will go deep into the operation. You work closely with CX, analyze reviews, returns, pricing, and advertising, and learn how our business and [
](
) truly operate.



A large part of your early focus will be building the Customer Experience and review engine. This includes analyzing reviews and returns, identifying structural issues, and building scalable processes that improve rating, trust, and ranking.



At the same time, you execute review & relevance growth: influencer outreach via social media, building affiliate partnerships, and testing additional channels that increase ranking and visibility on [
](
).



Your goal: identify the main leverage points, take immediate action where impact is highest, and bring structure to KPIs, processes, and priorities.





Phase 2 ‚Äì Scale and lead



Once the foundation is in place, you lead CX, build the commercial team, and focus on commercial optimization and scaling. You evolve from builder to leader. Phase 2 may still include some operational responsibilities, but the ultimate goal is to gradually phase out all operational tasks within the team so you can fully focus on leadership, strategy, and growth.



What you will do

- Structure and lead CX

- Optimize listings and advertising (together with our PPC partner)

- Define pricing and promotion strategies

- Build and scale review, influencer, and affiliate acceleration

- Turn returns/refund data into product and process improvements

- KPI reporting (scorecard)

- Bi-weekly alignment with CEO (priorities + decisions)

- Act as the strategic counterpart for 



No overanalysis. Focus on leverage.



Who you are



8+ years marketplace e-commerce experience with a proven track record in revenue growth. Deep understanding of marketplace algorithms. Commercially sharp, data-driven, high ownership. Hands-on in the beginning, able to build and lead a team.



What we want to see



No standard CV. We want proof of what you built and led.



Include:

- A short description of a marketplace structure you built or scaled

- The processes you developed (CX structure, review acceleration, pricing, KPI dashboards)

- Measurable results (revenue growth, conversion, review score, refund rate, ranking)



No theory. No generic marketing stories.



What we offer



A key leadership role with direct impact. Full commercial ownership and the opportunity to build Onebird‚Äôs entire 
 growth engine.



This is not a safe hire. This is a key position.

Are you the builder who becomes the leader?

title: Social media manager
description:
Finding the right social media manager is difficult.

Someone who does things the same way I would do them, with all my knowledge and experience of our program and our target audience internalized‚Ä¶ but better. Of course that someone does not exist (yet!).



Plenty of people respond to my ads, but it‚Äôs hard to find that one right person. That person with the right skills, the right insights, and the right feeling for what we do. 



Social media is a complex discipline. You do not learn this from a course, some online tips, or from experience in a previous position. You learn this by understanding the specific market and target audience, by working with results and numbers, and by analyzing what worked and what didn‚Äôt. To start all over again tomorrow, because the algorithms have changed. 



A feeling for what we are doing is important. Also talent in authentic writing, good visual awareness, the ability to see what to post, when and where, and to monitor the results of your posts. This is where a certain talent comes in. 



We are looking for a social media manager who fits this description.

The position is for 20 hours a week, including some tasks on weekends. 

You can work from home and mostly plan your own working hours.

Payment is 15000 PHP/month, based on 20 hours/week.



About us:

Arcticterns.global is a non profit foundation that creates gatherings for traveling families to build community they often miss because of their lifestyle. We host month long programs in different countries, where families come together, connect, learn, and grow. Community is at the heart of everything we do.



Interested?

- Please send a cover letter in which you explain why you are interested and the skills that make you a strong fit for this role. Please make sure your authentic writing skills show in the cover letter and do not use AI. 

- Please complete the IQ test and the DISC test this platform offers.

title: SALES & OPERATIONS COORDINATOR
description:
SALES & OPERATIONS COORDINATOR



ABOUT VERTEX FLEET



Vertex Fleet is a leading national truck parking and real estate network, specializing in outdoor industrial storage (IOS). We address the critical truck parking shortage across the United States by offering secure, accessible, and strategically located parking solutions for the freight and logistics industry. With an aggressive expansion strategy targeting 100 locations nationwide, Vertex Fleet is revolutionizing the IOS and fleet parking industry through cutting-edge technology, innovative business practices, and unparalleled customer service.



POSITION OVERVIEW



We are seeking a highly organized and customer-focused Sales & Operations Coordinator to manage the daily operational and sales functions that keep our parking facilities running smoothly. This is a dynamic, multifaceted role perfect for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment and enjoys both customer interaction and behind-the-scenes coordination. You'll be the vital link between our customers, our facilities, and our operations‚Äîhandling everything from inventory tracking and payment collection to sales calls and negotiating with yard owners in new markets.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Inventory & Facility Management

‚Ä¢ Track daily parking inventory across all Vertex Fleet locations

‚Ä¢ Monitor which customers have arrived and departed from facilities

‚Ä¢ Maintain accurate, real-time records of space occupancy and availability

‚Ä¢ Update parking management system with current inventory status

‚Ä¢ Coordinate with on-site managers regarding space availability and customer movements

‚Ä¢ Generate daily, weekly, and monthly occupancy reports



Customer Billing & Payment Management

‚Ä¢ Make outbound calls to customers regarding payment collection

‚Ä¢ Follow up on outstanding invoices and past-due accounts

‚Ä¢ Process payments and update customer account records

‚Ä¢ Create and send invoices to B2B and B2C customers

‚Ä¢ Maintain organized records of all billing and payment transactions

‚Ä¢ Handle customer billing inquiries and resolve payment issues

‚Ä¢ Implement payment reminder systems to reduce delinquencies

Sales & Customer Acquisition

‚Ä¢ Handle inbound sales calls from trucking companies, fleet managers, and independent drivers

‚Ä¢ Make outbound sales calls to prospective B2B and B2C customers

‚Ä¢ Provide information about Vertex Fleet's parking solutions, rates, and facility amenities

‚Ä¢ Conduct sales outreach in cities where Vertex Fleet does not currently have parking facilities

‚Ä¢ Qualify leads and convert prospects into paying customers

‚Ä¢ Present pricing options and close sales for daily, monthly, and long-term parking contracts

‚Ä¢ Build and maintain strong relationships with existing customers to encourage retention and referrals



Administrative & Coordination Tasks

‚Ä¢ Respond to
s and customer inquiries promptly

‚Ä¢ Support other team members with administrative tasks as needed



REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS



‚Ä¢ High school diploma or equivalent (Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred)

‚Ä¢ Minimum 2-3 years of experience in sales, customer service, or operations coordination

‚Ä¢ Proven ability to handle collections and payment follow-up professionally

‚Ä¢ Strong phone communication skills and comfort making outbound calls

‚Ä¢ Experience with invoicing, billing, and basic accounting processes

‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in Microsoft Office (Excel, Word) and CRM software

‚Ä¢ Ability to multitask and manage competing priorities effectively

‚Ä¢ Self-motivated and able to work independently in a remote environment

‚Ä¢ Professional, friendly demeanor with strong customer service orientation



PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS



‚Ä¢ Experience in the trucking, logistics, transportation, or parking industry

‚Ä¢ Background in B2B sales or account management

‚Ä¢ Familiarity with the trucking industry and driver/fleet needs

‚Ä¢ Experience negotiating contracts or business agreements

‚Ä¢ Bilingual (English/Spanish) is highly desirable

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of industrial outdoor storage or commercial real estate

‚Ä¢ Previous experience working remotely







WHAT YOU'LL LOVE ABOUT THIS ROLE



‚Ä¢ **Variety**: No two days are the same‚Äîyou'll handle sales, operations, and negotiations all in one role

‚Ä¢ **Impact**: Your work directly affects Vertex Fleet's growth and customer satisfaction

‚Ä¢ **Autonomy**: Remote work with the freedom to manage your schedule and priorities

‚Ä¢ **Growth**: Opportunity to expand your skills in sales, operations, and business development



COMPENSATION & BENEFITS



‚Ä¢ Competitive base salary

‚Ä¢ Performance-based commission and bonuses

‚Ä¢ Fully remote work environment

‚Ä¢ Professional development opportunities

‚Ä¢ Growth potential as Vertex Fleet expands nationwide



WORK SCHEDULE



‚Ä¢ Full-time, Monday through Friday (weekends optional)

‚Ä¢ Flexibility to accommodate customer needs and different time zones 

‚Ä¢ Occasional evening or weekend availability may be required



TO APPLY



Please submit your resume and a brief cover letter explaining:

‚Ä¢ Your experience in sales and/or operations coordination

‚Ä¢ Your comfort level with collections and payment follow-up

‚Ä¢ Any experience you have in the trucking, logistics, or parking industry

‚Ä¢ Why you're interested in joining Vertex Fleet



Vertex Fleet is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.



Join our team and help revolutionize truck parking across America!

Performance-based bonuses.

mber?

title: Short Form/Long Form Video Editor for Growing YouTube/TikTok Channel
description:
About Us

We are a rapidly growing educational content channel focused on everyday curiosity - explaining the fascinating science, psychology, and hidden design behind ordinary things. We create content that makes viewers think "I need to tell someone about this" rather than just surface-level facts.



We post 2 short-form videos daily (90 Second Format), and 3 long-form videos weekly (7 Minute Format), using an AI talking head with professional voiceover. Our content is backed by real research, studies, and expert references to build authority and credibility.



What You'll Be Editing



Short-Form Content (60 shorts/month):

90-second TikTok/YouTube Shorts

9:16 vertical format

Educational/curiosity-driven topics



Long-Form Content (8-12 videos/month):

7:02 minute YouTube videos

16:9 horizontal format

Deep-dive educational content



What We'll Provide You

Pre-recorded AI talking head footage (9:16 ratio, ~1 minute per short)

AI voice over audio already synced to video

Full scripts with B-roll notes and reference materials

Brand kit (colors: gold, blue, dark theme)

Access to stock footage resources

Clear style guidelines and example videos



Your Responsibilities Per Video

Required Elements:



Dynamic, animated captions (fast-paced, engaging style)

License-free background music that matches video energy

B-roll video footage to maintain engagement

Dynamic sound effects/clips for emphasis

Zoom in/out effects on talking head for key 
nts

B-roll images where relevant

Color grading for professional, consistent look

Thumbnail creation (shorts and long-form)



Quality Standards:

Maintain consistent brand aesthetic across all videos

Smooth transitions and professional pacing

Audio mixing (music doesn't overpower voice)

Attention-grabbing first 3 seconds

Retention-focused editing (cutting dead space, maintaining energy)



Ideal Candidate Has

Required:



Proven experience editing YouTube Shorts/TikTok content

Portfolio showing talking-head style educational or curiosity content

Proficiency in CapCut, Adobe Premiere, or Final Cut Pro

Understanding of retention editing and platform-specific best practices

Fast turnaround time while maintaining quality

Reliable internet and ability to meet daily/weekly deadlines



Bonus Points:



Experience with AI avatar/talking head content

Knowledge of YouTube/TikTok algorithm and what drives engagement

Understanding of educational content pacing

Experience creating thumbnails

Familiarity with tools like ElevenLabs, HeyGen, or similar



Work Schedule & Volume



60 short-form videos per month (2 per day)

8-12 long-form videos per month (3 per week)

Consistent delivery schedule required

Quick communication response during Philippines business hours preferred



Application Requirements

To apply, please include:



Portfolio link - Must include examples of:



Talking-head style content you've edited

Short-form vertical videos (TikTok/YouTube Shorts)

Long-form YouTube content (if applicable)



Brief introduction explaining:



Your video editing experience (years/volume)

Editing software you use

Your typical turnaround time per video

Why you're interested in video editing



Answer these questions:



What's your process for sourcing engaging B-roll?

How do you approach retention editing for short-form content?

Can you maintain a consistent style across 60+ videos per month?

What's your revision policy?

What software and services do you already have access to?



Trial Process



We'll start with a paid trial of 5 short-form videos

You'll receive detailed feedback and brand guidelines

We will build out what the brand will look like and I will take your vision into account. 

Successful candidates will move to ongoing monthly engagement

Templates and workflows will be established during trial period



What Makes This Role Great



Consistent, predictable work volume (no feast/famine)

Creative input welcomed on retention and engagement strategies

Growing channel with potential for performance bonuses

Clear brand guidelines (no guessing what we want)

Opportunity to be part of a channel's growth from early stage



Pay/Salary:



This will be a full-time hybrid pay position.  The starting offer is $500/mo. to perform the above metrics.  There will be multiple bonus structures discussed in the initial interview.  These bonus structures will include hitting metrics like 100k view in first 7 days, 500k views in first 7 days, Over 1M views in first 7 days, Bonuses for every 10k followers/subscribers and these bonuses will be for both platforms.  I will share a PDF of this binus structure if you are a final candidate.

title: Data Scientist
description:
The role: 



Earn up to $800 - $1,500 per month (depending on experience) as a Data Scientist at Venture Smarter, your trusted partner in navigating the complex landscape of business growth and transition.



As a Data Scientist, you will leverage your skills and expertise in data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence to extract valuable insights from large and complex data sets. You will work on various projects and initiatives that aim to improve our products and services, enhance customer experience, and drive business growth and innovation.



Head on over to search on Google for ‚ÄúVenture Smarter‚Äù then go to our Career page from the homepage ‚Äì if you dare to aspire for better in your career!



**** Given the high number of applications we receive, we will only respond to those who meet the qualifications for the positions applied for.



Please note that we will not reply to job application inquiries sent to our social media accounts. All communication from us will be conducted via
.



If you do not receive a response, you are welcome to re-apply after six months for another suitable position within our company. ****





Venture Smarter has been featured in media outlets such as CBS News, Digital Journal, and Go Banking Rates. Check us out ‚Äì you‚Äôll know we‚Äôre the place to be.



What the job entails:



‚Ä¢  Collect, clean, and preprocess data from various sources, such as databases, APIs, web scraping, or surveys



‚Ä¢  Explore and analyze data to discover patterns, trends, and anomalies, and generate hypotheses and questions



‚Ä¢  Build and test predictive models and machine learning algorithms, using tools such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn



‚Ä¢  Evaluate and optimize the performance and accuracy of the models and algorithms, and fine-tune the parameters and features



‚Ä¢  Deploy and integrate the models and algorithms into production systems and applications, using tools such as Flask, Docker, or Kubernetes



‚Ä¢  Create and deliver data products and solutions, such as dashboards, reports, and visualizations, using tools such as Plotly, D3.js, or Shiny



‚Ä¢  Communicate and explain complex data and findings to various stakeholders and audiences, using clear and compelling language and visuals



‚Ä¢  Conduct research and experiments on new and emerging data science, machine learning, and artificial intelligence techniques and technologies, and apply them to business problems and opportunities





Job Requirements:

title: Administrative & Customer Support Assistant
description:
ROLE OVERVIEW

This role is ideal for a detail-oriented, tech-capable admin professional who thrives in structured work, enjoys keeping businesses organized, and can confidently support invoicing and customer follow-up processes. They will need strong operational instincts, comfort with invoicing systems, and the ability to learn new tools quickly.



KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Invoicing & Accounts Support:

- Input invoices into Sage (or similar accounting system)

- Process, monitor, and track incoming cash receipts

- Follow up on late payments and overdue invoices

- Email invoices to customers daily or weekly based on schedule

- Maintain clean records of billing and payment status



Client Communication & Quote Follow-Up

- Support customer service via email communication

- Follow up with clients on outstanding quotes and pending approvals

- Ensure no client requests or proposals fall through the cracks

- Help the team stay responsive while protecting their time



Administrative Organization

- Organize inbox workflows and manage calendar scheduling

- Assist with appointment coordination, reminders, and task tracking

- Build repeatable systems for day-to-day admin operations



Systems & Tech Support (Critical Need)

- Assist in evaluating and selecting a new Operating System/software platform

- Help port administrative processes into updated tools

- Improve internal workflows through automation, templates, and structure

- Comfortable working across Google Workspace, CRMs, invoicing tools, and new platforms



IDEAL CANDIDATE PROFILE

- Extremely organized and detail-oriented

- Confident handling invoicing, billing support, and client follow-up

- Tech-savvy and comfortable learning new systems quickly

- Proactive ‚Äî doesn‚Äôt wait to be told what‚Äôs broken

- Strong written communicator with a professional customer-facing tone

- Experienced supporting small business owners or operations teams



PREFERRED EXPERIENCE

- Admin support, customer support, or operations assistance

- Familiarity with invoicing/accounting tools (Sage is a plus)

- Experience helping companies implement new software or workflows

- VA experience supporting U.S.-based service businesses



SUCCESS IN THIS ROLE LOOKS LIKE

- Invoices go out consistently and on time

- Late payments are tracked and followed up systematically

- Client quote follow-up becomes reliable and automated

- Calendar, inbox, and admin workload feel under control

- The organization transitions smoothly into stronger systems and operating structure



HOURS & COMPENSATION

- Starting at 10~20 hours/week

- Opportunity to expand into a long-term operations support role

- Competitive compensation based on experience and technical skill

title: Video Editor who #Believes in Entrepreneurs| Flexible Work Schedule
description:
We're trying to solve the world's biggest problem: People don't #Believe in themselves enough. For over 22 years, Evan Carmichael has been dedicated to this mission. The way we're approaching this problem is producing inspirational content at scale. The right video at the right time can completely change someone's life and we want to touch as many lives as possible. People may not have a supportive family or community around them, but our content can help give them the belief they need to chase their dreams and make the world a better place. We want to work with people who also want to make an impact and touch people's lives. In your application, please put ‚ÄòI am your next awesome Video Editor!‚Äô in the subject line. Please apply through OnlineJobsPh and not via
. The job responsibilities include editing the first minute of videos to grab and keep the audience's attention, selecting the most engaging clips, adding eye-catching transitions and effects, ensuring the sound and visuals are top-notch, and staying on top of the latest trends to keep things fresh. Our goal is to get to 70% audience retention in the first minute. Additionally, strong creativity, attention to detail, and effective communication skills are essential to produce high-quality videos that engage viewers and meet retention goals. Please also share the link to your resume and portfolio, what your hourly salary expectations are, and in the first line of your message tell us how many YouTube subscribers Evan Carmichael has, followed by who your favorite entrepreneur of all time is and why. The job is full time (40 hours per week) with a flexible schedule. We would start off with a small project for now and we'd pay you for your ideas and research. We also like to work with people over a long period of time, not just short contracts, and give them opportunities to succeed and do more based on what they want to learn. Hopefully that will be you! Thank you for reading and good luck! Sending lots of love! -Irish #Believe

title: Customer Service Member
description:
Remote Customer Service Member (Work from Home)

Independent Contractor



A prominent and growing North American facilities services organization is expanding its remote operations support and is seeking dependable, detail-oriented customer support professionals. This is a work-from-home contractor engagement supporting commercial and retail clients across Canada.



This is an independent contractor engagement, paid weekly upon receipt of invoice. The schedule is 9-hour shifts, five (5) days per week. Occasional Saturday shifts (approximately once per month) may be required. Shifts align with Eastern Standard Time: 8:00‚Äì5:00, 9:00‚Äì6:00, or 10:00‚Äì7:00 EST.



Role Overview

This is a dynamic, high-energy administrative and customer support position where every day brings new experiences and opportunities for professional growth. The role involves real-time coordination via Zoom and other internal systems to progress various tasks.



As an independent contractor working with our Customer Service Team, you‚Äôll play a key role in maintaining the efficient flow of work orders through our systems and processes. 



Based on your skills and interests, you‚Äôll be assigned to one of our specialized sub-teams:



‚Ä¢
ing Team: Monitor and manage an inbox with thousands of daily incoming
s, sort and flag urgent or high-priority
s, and collaborate with relevant teams.

‚Ä¢ Scheduling Team: Dispatch and schedule work orders with technicians to ensure timely completion.

‚Ä¢ Compiling Team: Handle compiling tasks, including before/after photos, invoices, sign-offs, assisting with month-end closures, and answering phones.

‚Ä¢ Check-In/Out Team: Sign in technicians as they arrive on-site for jobs, address any issues or scope changes, and ensure smooth operations while technicians are on location.



Each sub-team works collaboratively to deliver exceptional service while minimizing bottlenecks in our workflows.



Requirements for Home Office Set Up:

‚Ä¢ Windows PC preferred, running Windows 11

‚Ä¢ Minimum 300 Mbps internet speed; Fibre connection strongly preferred

‚Ä¢ Multiple monitors required (single monitor setups not suitable)

‚Ä¢ High-quality headset with a microphone and a Reliable webcam

‚Ä¢ Quiet, professional workspace suitable for full-day Zoom collaboration

Traits We Are Seeking:

Organization: You can handle high
 volumes, prioritize tasks, and keep everything on track.

Problem-solving: You take initiative, think independently, and easily resolve issues.

Collaborative Communicator: You work confidently with others, fostering accountability and motivation. You are a positive, self-motivated individual with clear communication.

Composed Under Pressure: You enjoy working within tight deadlines and fast-paced environments. 

Proven work history: You are looking for a long-term opportunity and have a proven track record. Experience in virtual assistance, remote administrative roles, or customer service preferred.

Strong technical Skills: You have in-depth technical skills with the ability to work in several systems and databases at one time

title: Remote Maintenance Manager VA (Full Time)
description:
Position: Remote Maintenance Manager VA (Maintenance Coordinator / Property-Management VA)

Company: HABU Management LLC ‚Äì U.S. residential property-management & real-estate investment firm

Work Hours: 8 hrs/day between 8 AM ‚Äì 6 PM MST (Mon‚ÄìFri)

Compensation: US $1,000 per month

Target Start: ASAP



About the Role

We need a detail-oriented, systems-minded VA to run all maintenance operations for our single-family and small-multifamily portfolio. You‚Äôll triage tenant requests, dispatch vendors, track work orders in AppFolio, and keep costs low while solving problems fast.



Key Responsibilities

- Work-Order Intake & Triage ‚Äì receive tenant requests via AppFolio, phone, and email; classify them (emergency / urgent / routine) and open work orders within 1 hour.

- Vendor Coordination ‚Äì maintain an up-to-date vendor roster, request quotes, schedule jobs, and confirm completion with photos and invoices.

- Preventive Maintenance ‚Äì manage recurring schedules (HVAC, pest, landscaping), track warranties, and alert owners to upcoming cap-ex items.

- Tenant & Owner Updates ‚Äì send status updates at key milestones and escalate unresolved or high-cost issues with clear options.

- Quality & Cost Control ‚Äì verify workmanship, request re-work when needed, monitor spend vs. budget, and suggest cost-saving ideas.

- Reporting & Documentation ‚Äì close work orders and generate a weekly maintenance summary; keep SOPs and vendor scorecards current.

- Process Improvement ‚Äì analyze maintenance trends and propose system tweaks to shorten response times and reduce costs.



Must-Have Technical Requirements

- Internet: hard-wired, stable  -25 Mbps down / 10 Mbps up + backup hotspot

- Hardware: desktop/laptop with 8 GB RAM minimum & dual-monitor capability

- Power Backup: UPS or generator for outages

- Workspace: quiet area suitable for VoIP calls



Preferred Experience & Soft-Skill Traits

- AppFolio power-user ‚Äì 6 + months managing work orders & vendors

- Prior maintenance or property-management coordination for U.S. rentals

- Clear spoken & written English; systems thinker who loves SOPs & checklists

- Proactive, highly organized, calm under pressure, reliable, and eager to learn



What We Offer

- US $1,000 per month direct deposit (paid bi-weekly)

- Health-insurance reimbursement after 90-day probationary period

- Equipment reimbursement for essential hardware after onboarding

- 90-day probationary period with performance review at completion

- Stable, long-term assignment‚Äîbecome part of the client‚Äôs core team, not a short project



How to Apply

1. Complete the Google Form (link below) and include:

 

- Resume link (Google Drive, Dropbox, etc.)

- 150‚Äì300-word writing sample 

- 1‚Äì2 minute voice introduction 

- 16Personalities test result ‚Äî take the free test at 16Personalities.com

- Internet speed-test screenshot ‚Äî run at Speedtest.net



2. Answer two scenario questions in the form to show how you solve real maintenance problems.



Only candidates who submit all items through the form will be considered. We review every application and will contact shortlisted applicants for a live interview and skills test.



- Google Form: https://forms.gle/Xov8rxhxqPVb4n8b9



We look forward to partnering with a proactive Maintenance Manager VA who will help us deliver top-notch service to our tenants and property owners!

title: Extremely Detail Oriented Virtual Assistant - Data Entry, Order Fulfillment, Phone Calls
description:
Hello,



I have a small e-commerce industrial supply company in the USA. We receive orders on our websites and we place those order with our vendors on their websites who drop ships the order directly to our customers. We are the distributor (also called the "middleman" by some people). You will be working directly with me (the owner) everyday.

We are hiring for a full time, long term Virtual Assistant who will call our vendors to check stock and price, enter new orders on our vendors websites,¬†enter tracking information to fill orders on our websites. This position will work 8 hours per day, 40 hours per week Monday - Friday during USA hours (10pm-6pm Manila time). You must be exclusive to this job, you cannot do other work or side jobs if hired. Your full concentration must be on this job.



-¬† You will reply to
s that come into our general sales inbox. Most of these
s are to check stock availability and price of items.



¬†- You will make about 20 phone calls per day to our vendors to check availability of items and also call customers if additional details are required about their order.



- You will place orders online with our vendors which will drop ship direct to our customers.



Requirements for this position:



- CRITICAL THINKING SKILLS / COMMON SENSE

- Fast on the computer, writing
s and using internet

- Great English speaking and writing skills

- Long term position (we want this person to be with us for years)

- 10pm-6am daily Manila time. Monday to Friday

- Extreme attention to details (THIS IS A MUST)

- Excellent with numbers and math

- Excellent with Data entry

- Honest and Loyal

- Willing to learn and ask questions

- WILL NOT DISAPPEAR

- Expert working on a computer

- Expert using
 (Gmail)

- Expert using the internet and placing orders online

- Great with Microsoft Excel and Word

- Knows how to use

- Reliable internet connection



To make sure you have fully read this job description in your application
 please include this in the subject and as the first line: "I am ok to work from 10pm - 6am weekdays and commit to doing so for 5 years or more. I am the perfect VA001!!!"

You must use at least 30 Apply Points to show you are serious about this job; otherwise your
 will not be read and you will not be considered for this job.

Reply to these questions in your
:

1. Are you willing to work 10pm-6am Manila time? Have you ever worked similar hours before for an extended period of time? If so please explain.

2. Are you comfortable on the phone and do you have experience on the phone for¬†previous¬†jobs? Do you have experience speaking on the phone in English? If so please explain.¬†

3. Are you detail oriented and good with numbers and math? If so please explain.

4. Are you fast working on the computer?¬†

5. Do you check your work for errors? If you make repeated errors and multiple errors in short period of time you will not last and we will replace you quickly. DO NOT APPLY TO THIS JOB IF YOU ARE NOT CONFIDENT YOU CAN WORK ERROR FREE.

6. Do you have common sense and critical thinking skills? If so please explain.

7. What does the phrase "business savvy" mean? Does this phrase describe you?

8. Are you emotionally fragile or sensitive? If so please DO NOT APPLY. My personality is very direct and blunt. My communications with you will be quick, fast and blunt. I need someone who does not need me to babysit their sensitive personality. This is work and I am looking for a professional relationship with fast, direct communication. 





Thank You

Neil

title: Paid Social Video Editor
description:
About Us



We are a rapidly growing direct-to-consumer electronics brand specializing in protective earbuds for hunters and avid shooters. Launched just three months ago, we've achieved exceptional growth through strategic Meta advertising campaigns, currently scaling from $120,000/month to $500,000+/month in ad spend. Our lean team is focused on performance-driven creative that converts.



Position Overview



We're seeking a highly skilled Full-Time Paid Social Video Editor to join our creative team and help drive our aggressive scaling goals on Meta platforms. You'll work closely with our Creative Strategist and content creators to produce high-performing video ads that resonate with our target audience and drive conversions at scale.



Key Responsibilities



* Video Production: Produce 8-10 unique concept videos per week for Meta advertising campaigns

* Creative Execution: Transform creative briefs into compelling video ads across multiple formats including UGC, AI UGC, AI B-roll, and VSLs (Video Sales Letters)

* Brief Adherence: Meticulously follow creative briefs and strategist direction while maintaining attention to detail throughout the editing process

* Collaboration: Work closely with the Creative Strategist to implement feedback, refine concepts, and iterate on creative approaches

* Quality Control: Ensure all video outputs meet brand standards and performance benchmarks

* Asset Management: Organize and maintain video assets, templates, and project files efficiently

* Performance Optimization: Adapt editing techniques based on creative performance data and platform best practices





Experience Requirements



* 2+ years of proven experience creating Meta ad creatives for direct-response e-commerce brands

* Extensive portfolio demonstrating expertise in:



UGC (User-Generated Content) ads

AI UGC ads

AI B-roll ads

VSLs (Video Sales Letters)



* Track record of producing ads that have driven measurable performance results



Technical Skills



* Expert proficiency in video editing software (Adobe Premiere Pro, Final Cut Pro, CapCut, or similar)

* Strong understanding of Meta ad specifications, platform requirements, and best practices

* Experience with AI tools for content creation (e.g., HeyGen, Arc Ads, ElevenLabs, or similar)

* Knowledge of motion graphics and text animation

* Understanding of sound design and audio mixing for social media



Key Competencies



* Exceptional attention to detail with ability to follow briefs precisely

* Strong understanding of direct-response advertising principles

* Ability to work efficiently under deadline pressure while maintaining quality

* Self-motivated with excellent time management skills

* Strong communication skills for collaborating with remote teams

* Creative problem-solving abilities



Preferred Qualifications (Bonus)



* Experience designing static ads for Meta platforms

* Knowledge of graphic design software (Adobe Photoshop, Canva, Figma)

* Experience in the hunting, outdoor, tactical, or consumer electronics niches

* Understanding of Meta Ads Manager and creative performance metrics





Portfolio Requirements



Your portfolio must include:



* Multiple examples of UGC-style ads you've edited

* Examples of AI UGC ads demonstrating realistic execution

* AI B-roll ads showing creative use of AI-generated footage

* Before/after examples or case studies showing performance results (if available)



Note: Applications without a comprehensive portfolio demonstrating the required ad formats will not be considered.



What We Offer



* Competitive full-time compensation commensurate with experience

* High-impact role on a rapidly scaling brand with proven product-market fit

* Creative autonomy within strategic frameworks

* Direct collaboration with experienced performance marketers

* Remote flexibility - work from anywhere

* Growth opportunity - be part of a brand scaling from $120k/month to $500k+/month in ad spend

* Fast-paced environment where your work directly impacts revenue and growth



Expected Workflow



* Receive creative briefs from Creative Strategist

* Produce 8-10 unique concept videos weekly across various formats

* Implement feedback and revisions from strategist and founder

* Maintain organized asset library and project files

* Participate in creative strategy discussions and performance reviews

title: High-End Social Media Content Creator & Video Editor (Real Estate Aesthetic)
description:
We are looking for a creative Social Media Manager and Video Editor who can create the high-end, elegant, and authentic content style of Kelsie 
 - 



We absolutely love her style. We will of course add our own twist on things, but this is a goal in terms of quality to strive for.



Our goal is to produce "Quiet Luxury" real estate content that builds trust and showcases properties with a minimalist, professional aesthetic. You will be responsible for taking raw footage and turning it into scroll-stopping Reels, Carousels, and Stories.



Responsibilities:



Video Editing: Create 2-3 Reels per week. Edits must be clean, avoid "over-the-top" transitions, and focus on high-quality color grading (airy/warm aesthetic).



Graphic Design: Design minimalist Instagram Carousels and property highlight graphics using Canva.



Copywriting: Write captions that sound professional yet personal‚Äîfocusing on "Authenticity" over "Salesy" language.



Trend Monitoring: Identify trending audios that fit a luxury/lifestyle niche (not just what's popular, but what's classy).



Engagement: Optimize posts with relevant SEO keywords for real estate (e.g., [Your City] Real Estate, Luxury Living).



Required Skills:



Expert in CapCut: Deep knowledge of keyframes, masking, and clean text overlays.



Expert in Canva: Ability to work with high-end typography and minimalist layouts.



Color Grading: Experience using Lightroom or Premiere Pro to create a consistent "vibe" across all video content.



Portfolio Requirement: You MUST provide examples of real estate or luxury lifestyle content you have edited.



Software Proficiency Needed:



CapCut (Mobile & Desktop)



Canva



Adobe Lightroom (for Video/Photo color consistency)



Instagram/TikTok Native Editors



Bonus: Adobe Premiere Pro or Final Cut Pro



Salary: A per job/reel basis with agreed upon $ amount or per hour basis. Bonus available based on views/engagement metrics.

title: Home Health Quality Assurance Representative
description:

This role is pivotal in ensuring the accuracy and completeness of healthcare notes for our home health partners, making you an essential part of our team. If you're passionate about ensuring the accuracy and quality of patient assessment data, we want to hear from you!



Position Overview:

As a Quality Assurance Representative, you will play a critical role in maintaining the highest standards of patient assessment data in our organization. You will be responsible for reviewing and assessing Physical Therapists, Occupational Therapists, and Speech Therapists documentation to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal quality standards.



Key Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Review and assess documentation for accuracy and completeness.

‚Ä¢ Verify that assessments are compliant with CMS regulations and agency policies.

‚Ä¢ Identify and report discrepancies or issues in the documentation.

‚Ä¢ Collaborate with clinical staff to provide feedback and ensure data accuracy.

‚Ä¢ Collaborating with home health partners and therapist to ensure the timely and accurate delivery of notes.



Qualifications:

‚Ä¢ 2+ year of experience with Quality Assurance (QA) of healthcare notes:

‚Ä¢ Prior experience with international healthcare companies: 

‚Ä¢ Candidates should have an understanding of clinical records and be able to spot inaccuracies and omissions.

‚Ä¢ Ability to provide constructive feedback and recommendations for improving healthcare notes.

‚Ä¢ Knowledge for various EMR's is a plus. (Devero, Axxess, Kinnser)

‚Ä¢ Must be available to work full-time hours: Mon ‚Äì Fri, 9am ‚Äì 5:30pm Pacific Standard Time.

title: Executive Virtual Assistant ‚Äî CRO Support (Financial Services)
description:
Role:



The Executive Virtual Assistant is the operational backbone of a fast-growing financial advisory firm. You'll work directly with the Chief Revenue Officer to eliminate bottlenecks, execute processes, and keep systems running so leadership can focus on strategy instead of admin.



This isn't a "check your
 and schedule meetings" VA role. You'll be inside HubSpot pulling reports and executing outreach, posting social media replies through Sprout Social, coordinating contractors, running SMS broadcasts, and keeping our project management system clean and current. You'll follow SOPs we've already built, but you'll also be expected to flag when something is broken and suggest a better way.



Here's what you'll actually do:



- Post AI-generated social media replies across
, Instagram, LinkedIn, YouTube, and X through Sprout Social ‚Äî reviewing each for quality before publishing

- Manage SMS broadcast campaigns ‚Äî pulling lists from HubSpot, scheduling sends, and monitoring delivery

- Pull and compile reports from HubSpot ‚Äî surfacing key metrics, pipeline snapshots, and deal activity summaries so leadership doesn't have to dig for information

- Keep our project management system (Asana) organized ‚Äî chasing tea
mbers for status updates, archiving dead projects, and ensuring dashboards reflect reality

- Handle webinar logistics ‚Äî registration list management, reminder sequences, post-event follow-up segmentation, and replay distribution

- Coordinate marketing contractors ‚Äî collecting deliverables, tracking deadlines, routing approvals, and following up so nothing falls through the cracks



To win in this role, you need to be detail-oriented, proactive, and comfortable working across multiple platforms simultaneously. You should be someone who takes ownership of processes ‚Äî not someone who waits to be told what to do next.



## Why This Role Matters (for You):



If you want to learn how a high-growth US financial services company actually operates ‚Äî from sales pipelines to marketing automation to client experience ‚Äî this role gives you a front-row seat.



You'll work directly with leadership, not through layers of middle management. You'll touch every part of the business: sales ops, marketing, content, client experience, and technology. That breadth of exposure is rare and will make you significantly more valuable in any future role.



We invest in training. We have documented SOPs, video walkthroughs, and AI tools that do the heavy thinking ‚Äî your job is reliable execution and continuous improvement. We don't micromanage, but we do expect ownership.



If you thrive in structured environments where the playbook exists and you just need to run it well ‚Äî you'll love this. If you need someone standing over your shoulder to stay productive, this isn't the right fit.



## Responsibilities



- Execute social media engagement workflows daily ‚Äî reviewing AI-generated replies for tone and accuracy, then publishing through Sprout Social across all platforms

- Manage and send SMS marketing broadcasts using our SMS platform, including list preparation and scheduling

- Own the YouTube production coordination workflow ‚Äî tracking recurring tasks, managing approvals, and ensuring content ships on schedule

- Compile weekly CRM reports ‚Äî pulling pipeline snapshots, deal velocity metrics, and activity summaries from HubSpot so leadership has what they need without digging for it

- Maintain project management hygiene in Asana ‚Äî collecting status updates, archiving completed or abandoned projects, and keeping dashboards accurate

- Coordinate webinar operations end-to-end ‚Äî from registration list pulls through post-event follow-up sequences

- Serve as the communication layer between leadership and marketing contractors ‚Äî tracking deliverables, deadlines, and approvals

- Document and improve processes ‚Äî when you find a better way to do something, write it down so it scales



## Results



- Social media replies posted within 24 hours of comment, with zero off-brand or inaccurate responses published

- Weekly CRM reports delivered on time ‚Äî leadership has pipeline and activity visibility without asking for it

- Asana dashboards reflect actual project status ‚Äî every active project has a current status update

- Webinar logistics executed without missed steps ‚Äî registrations captured, reminders sent, follow-ups segmented

- Contractor deliverables tracked and delivered on time ‚Äî nothing falls through the cracks between request and completion



## Requirements



- 3+ years of experience as a Virtual Assistant, Executive Assistant, or Operations Coordinator supporting US-based businesses

- Strong working knowledge of HubSpot CRM (deal management, contact properties, list building, task management)

- Experience with social media management tools (Sprout Social preferred, but Hootsuite, Buffer, or similar accepted)

- Proficiency in project management tools (Asana, Monday, ClickUp, or similar)

- Excellent written English ‚Äî you'll be reviewing client-facing social media content in a regulated industry

title: Canva Graphic Designer
description:
Hi there! I‚Äôm looking for a creative and responsible Canva Graphic Designer to join my small business. For the last 8 months, I worked with an amazing tea
mber from the Philippines who became a good friend, but he now needs to focus on his studies. Now, I‚Äôm looking for a new long-term partner to take over!

What we do:

We create personalized posters of clients' vehicles. The process is simple and fun:

We use Canva (we have templates and elements ready for you).

Each poster takes about 7-10 minutes to complete.

The Task: You check the orders on our website, read the client‚Äôs requirements (e.g., car brand and specs: Horsepower, Top speed and etc. "Make my car look like it's drifting with smoke from the rear tires and headlights on. Name of the car owner: Monnie Dobrev"), and create the design using the client‚Äôs photo.

AI Tools: If a photo isn't high quality or is partially cut, we use Google AI Studio (Nano Banana) to replicate the vehicle/background. We provide the account for you or you can use your own, its free!

Why join us?

Flexible Hours: Work whenever you want, as long as the daily orders are finished.

Native Guidance: Our previous employee (who worked with me for 8 months) is still here to help! He can guide you in your native language and explain everything about the posters and how we work.

Bonuses: Dedicated work is always rewarded with bonus payments!

Stability: I am looking for a partner for the long run.

Requirements:

Good eye for detail and experience with Canva.

Basic understanding of AI tools for photos generation (or willingness to learn ‚Äì it‚Äôs easy!).

Responsibility: I need someone I can trust to handle daily orders seriously.

If you are looking for a stable, friendly, and flexible job, I would love to hear from you!

Let's create something great together! :)

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)  |  Hours: Full-time, US Eastern Time (8 AM ‚Äì 5 PM ET and occasionally some after hours or weekend work |  Compensation: $800



About Field Nine Group

Field Nine Group is a strategic communications portfolio company led by Forbes 30 Under 30 recipient Adriana Lacy. Our brands include Adriana Lacy Consulting, Influencer Journalism, Channel Nine Studio, and SaaS products Social Chime and InsightFlow Analytics. We work with major media organizations, universities, and newsrooms globally. 



About the Role

We're looking for a highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented Executive Assistant to support our CEO directly. This role is the operational backbone of a fast-moving, one-person leadership team ‚Äî you'll manage communications, coordinate projects, and keep everything running smoothly so our CEO can focus on high-level strategy, client relationships, and business development. This is a remote role based in the Philippines, working US Eastern Time hours.



Responsibilities

 & Inbox Management

Triage and organize CEO's inbox daily ‚Äî flag urgent items, archive noise, draft responses for review

Respond to routine
s on behalf of the CEO using established templates and voice guidelines

Follow up on outstanding client communications and pending deliverables



Calendar & Scheduling

Manage CEO's calendar across multiple time zones (US, UK, Europe, Asia)

Schedule and confir
etings, calls, and speaking engagements

Coordinate travel logistics including flights, hotels, and ground transportation

Send meeting prep materials and agendas in advance



Project Coordination

Track client deliverables, deadlines, and project timelines across all Field Nine brands

Coordinate between the CEO, designers, and clients to keep projects moving

Manage Slack communications and route messages appropriately

Maintain organized project files and documentation in Google Drive



General Administrative Support

Prepare and format documents, proposals, and client-facing materials

Research and compile information as needed for meetings and pitches



Manage invoicing and payment follow-ups

Handle miscellaneous tasks as they arise ‚Äî no two days are the same



Requirements

2+ years of experience as a virtual assistant or executive assistant supporting a founder, CEO, or senior executive

Must be available to work US Eastern Time hours (9 AM ‚Äì 6 PM ET) consistently

Excellent written English ‚Äî you'll be drafting
s to major media organizations and clients on behalf of the CEO

Strong organizational skills and attention to detail



Experience with Google Workspace, Slack, and common project management tools

Ability to anticipate needs and take initiative without waiting to be asked

Comfortable working independently with minimal supervision

Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace



Nice to Have

Experience supporting clients in media, journalism, consulting, or communications

Familiarity with social media platforms and basic analytics

Experience with invoicing tools and basic bookkeeping

Previous experience working with US-based clients in a remote capacity



Why Join Field Nine

Work directly with a Forbes 30 Under 30 CEO building something meaningful in media and communications

Competitive compensation with room to grow as the company scales

Fully remote ‚Äî work from anywhere in the Philippines

Be part of a small, growing team where your impact is immediate and visible

Exposure to global media organizations including BBC, The Guardian, and Harvard's Nieman Foundation



How to Apply

Send your resume and a brief cover letter (3‚Äì5 sentences) explaining why you're a great fit for this role. In your cover letter, please include your experience working US hours and an example of how you've proactively solved a problem for a previous employer.

title: Junior Graphic Designer
description:
Location: Remote (Philippines)  |  Hours: Full-time, Philippines Time  |  Compensation: $600 monthly 



About Field Nine Group

Field Nine Group is a strategic communications portfolio company led by Forbes 30 Under 30 recipient Adriana Lacy. Our design studio, Channel Nine Studio, provides design services for media organizations, newsrooms, and consulting clients globally. We produce everything from brand identities and social media assets to print publications and presentation decks.



About the Role

We're looking for a talented Junior Graphic Designer to join our design team and work alongside our Senior Designer. You'll support a range of design projects across Channel Nine Studio's client base ‚Äî from social media graphics and presentation decks to print layouts and brand materials. This role is ideal for a designer who is hungry to grow, takes direction well, and wants to build their portfolio with meaningful work for major media and communications clients.



Responsibilities

Day-to-Day Design Work

Create social media graphics, infographics, and visual assets for clients across multiple brands

Design presentation decks, one-pagers, and client-facing documents

Assist with print layout and production including magazines, reports, and marketing materials

Adapt existing brand templates for new content and campaigns



Production Support

Prepare files for print and digital output (bleeds, crop marks, color profiles, export settings)

Resize and reformat designs across platforms and dimensions

Source and edit images, ensuring proper resolution and licensing

Maintain organized file structures in Google Drive and design tool libraries



Collaboration

Work closely with the Senior Designer on larger projects ‚Äî take direction, execute efficiently, and ask questions when needed

Implement feedback quickly and accurately across revision rounds

Communicate progress and flag potential issues proactively via Slack



Requirements

1‚Äì3 years of graphic design experience (agency, freelance, or in-house)

Strong proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite ‚Äî InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop required

Experience with print production (understanding of CMYK, bleed, DPI, preflight basics)

Strong proficiency in Figma (primary design tool) and working knowledge of Canva

Strong typography skills and an eye for layout and visual hierarchy

Ability to take creative direction and execute with precision

Reliable, communicative, and comfortable working independently

Portfolio demonstrating a range of design work across digital and print

Strong English communication skills ‚Äî you‚Äôll be receiving direction from US-based clients and need to communicate clearly via Slack and



Nice to Have

Experience designing for media, journalism, or publishing clients

Motion graphics or basic video editing skills (After Effects, Premiere)

Experience with magazine or editorial layout

Familiarity with web design and basic HTML/CSS



Why Join Channel Nine Studio

Work alongside an experienced Senior Designer who will mentor and develop your skills

Design for real clients at major media organizations ‚Äî build a portfolio that matters

Competitive compensation with room to grow as the studio scales



Fully remote ‚Äî work from anywhere in the Philippines during Philippines business hours

Be an early member of a growing design studio with real creative opportunity





How to Apply

Send your resume, portfolio link, and a brief cover letter (3‚Äì5 sentences). In your cover letter, tell us about a design project you're most proud of and why. We'd love to see a range of work ‚Äî digital, print, and anything in between.

title: Amazon FBA Product Research VA (Online Arbitrage, Wholesale, Scanning) (BONUSES) ($$ INCREASE POTENTIAL)
description:
We are a UK-based Amazon FBA business looking for a reliable Product Research Virtual Assistant to help identify profitable products for Online Arbitrage and Wholesale sourcing.



This role focuses on QUALITY OVER QUANTITY. The objective is not to analyse the highest number of products, but to identify stable, profitable opportunities that meet clear and realistic buying criteria.

....................................................................



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES



Scan supplier and wholesale product lists

Research products on Amazon UK

Analyse Keepa charts and price history

Calculate profit, ROI and competition levels

Identify stable and realistic buying opportunities

Record results accurately in Google Sheets



As the role develops, additional tasks may include researching potential suppliers and distributors and assisting with sourcing and supplier research.



This is a product research role only. No customer service, listing creation or advertising work is required.



....................................................................



REQUIREMENTS



Experience with Amazon FBA product research (Online Arbitrage or Wholesale)

Understanding of Keepa charts and Amazon fees

Strong attention to detail

Ability to prioritise accuracy over speed

Good English communication

Reliable internet connection



....................................................................



WORK STRUCTURE



Initial paid trial period (1 full day, 8 hours). In some cases a few trial days may be used to ensure a good long-term fit.

Trial rate: $2.00 per hour.

No bonus during the trial period.



After successful trial, the role moves to part-time and eventually full-time work.



We are looking for a long-term tea
mber. Pay for this role WILL increase over time as performance, reliability and results improve.



....................................................................



PAY STRUCTURE



Base pay is $3.00 per hour.



In addition, performance bonuses are paid for product leads that meet our buying criteria and are approved for purchase. The bonus structure rewards accuracy and quality rather than high volume.



Bonus structure example:



Approved product with approximately ¬£100‚Äì¬£199 total expected profit ? $3 bonus

Approved product with approximately ¬£200‚Äì¬£399 total expected profit ? $5 bonus

Approved product with approximately ¬£400+ total expected profit ? $15 bonus



This structure encourages focusing on stronger opportunities rather than sending large numbers of low-quality leads.



This will include any wholesale excel sheets I provide (I will be sending quite a few of these to be scanned)



We prefer fewer high-quality leads instead of many low-quality submissions.



....................................................................



EXAMPLE BUYING CRITERIA (FOR GUIDANCE ONLY)



The following is an example of our current criteria. This is not final and we will discuss and agree on realistic criteria together once work begins.



Minimum ROI around 30%

Minimum profit around ¬£3 per unit

Stable pricing history on Keepa

Reasonable competition levels

Products with strong overall profit potential



In general, if a product cannot comfortably generate approximately ¬£100 total profit per purchase, it is usually not worth buying. Higher profit opportunities are more likely to be selected.



Final criteria will be discussed and refined together to ensure they are realistic and achievable.



....................................................................



WHEN APPLYING, PLEASE ANSWER THE FOLLOWING



1) How many years of experience do you have with Amazon FBA product research?

2) Which tools do you use for research (Keepa, SellerAmp, etc.)?

3) Find one real profitable product OA or Wholesale and explain in detail why it is a good pick (Doesn't have to be 100% ROI I am interested in your reasoning and explanation as to why it is good. Minimum 20% ROI)

4) On average, how many OA or Wholesale leads do you believe you can find in a full working day? (Please be honest ‚Äî higher numbers do not mean better.)

5) What sourcing methods do you normally use (supplier lists, storefront research, reverse sourcing, manual sourcing, etc.)?

6) What criteria do you believe is most important when d
 if a product is a good buy?

7) Describe a situation where you d
 NOT to buy a product and why.



We value honest and realistic answers more than impressive numbers.



??????????????????



To confirm you have read the full job description, please include the word ‚ÄúKeepa‚Äù at the beginning of your application.



Responses will be reviewed very soon.

TO APPLY

title: Motion Designer
description:
Join a Video Studio That's Evolving



**Before you apply, read this carefully:**

We care about real people, not polished corporate robots.



If your application sounds like it was written by ChatGPT, we'll know. If your responses are generic or overly formal, we'll pass. If your video intro was recorded 6 months ago for a different company, that's an automatic disqualification.



We want to see:

-Your actual personality

-How you think and communicate

-Why you specifically are interested in this role



We don't want:

-Generic cover letter language

-AI-generated responses with no personal touch

-Recycled video introductions

-Corporate buzzwords



If you can't be bothered to personalize your application to VAAS, we can't be bothered to review it.



We're VAAS, a US-based video and motion design studio working with SaaS companies, venture capital firms, and tech-enabled businesses.



Here's what's happening:

-We're in the process of rebuilding our entire operation to work differently than most video studios.

-The goal: AI handles logistics and operations, so creatives can focus on judgment, taste, and craft.



We're building an agentic system where:

-Client requests get translated into structured briefs automatically

-Project management and file organization happen in the background

-You get clean inputs and creative clarity, not chaos



And we want someone who's excited to be part of that transformation.

What this means for you:



1. You'll learn AI tools as we adopt them ‚Äî We're actively experimenting with AI for asset generation, ideation, video generation, VO, and workflow automation. You'll build these skills in real time

2. You'll help shape the workflow ‚Äî Since we're building this, your feedback matters. What slows you down? What needs to be clearer? You'll have input

3. You'll focus more on creative work over time ‚Äî As we systemize operations, less of your day will be admin and back-and-forth. More will be actual design and motion work

4. Future-proof skills ‚Äî You'll learn how to work with AI, not compete against it. That's what will matter in 2-3 years



What we're looking for:

A motion designer who wants to be dangerously good and who's curious about how AI changes creative work.

You should have:



-Taste ‚Äî You can explain why something works or doesn't beyond "I like it"

-Design literacy ‚Äî You understand hierarchy, pacing, color, type, composition

-Curiosity about AI ‚Äî You don't need to be technical, but you should want to learn tools like Runway, Kling, ChatGPT, ElevenLabs, etc.

-Ownership ‚Äî You don't wait for pixel-perfect instructions. You think, propose, refine

-Range ‚Äî Comfortable with kinetic type, product UI animation, mixed media, editorial pacing

-Adaptability ‚Äî You're joining a studio that's evolving. That means some processes will change as we improve them



What you'll work on:

-SaaS product explainers and animations

-Founder-led content with motion graphics and design overlays

-Testimonial videos with branded treatments

-Event recaps and sizzle reels

-Podcast clips elevated beyond template edits

-Fixed-scope product animation projects (30‚Äì90 seconds, premium client work)

-Experimenting with AI video tools on real projects (with creative direction)



Tools you'll use:

-After Effects (required)

-Premiere Pro (required)

-Figma (for design frames and direction)


 (reviews)

-AI tools ‚Äî We're adopting Runway, Kling, ElevenLabs, ChatGPT, and others. We'll learn together



What we care about:

-Can you make a talking head video feel premium without overproducing it?

-Can you animate a SaaS product demo that's clear, not chaotic?

-Are you curious about how AI can speed up execution without killing taste?

-Do you solve problems or wait for instructions?

-Can you explain why you made a creative choice?



What we don't care about:

-Viral tricks or 
 edits

-Template-driven bulk content

-Trend-chasing for the sake of trends



Why this role is different:

Most editing jobs treat you like a production line. You get specs, you execute, repeat.



Here, you'll:

-Work on projects where the goal is credibility and craft, not just volume

-Have creative input, not just execute orders

-Learn AI tools that most Filipino editors don't touch

-Be part of a small team rethinking how creative studios operate



What you'll gain:

-Hands-on experience with AI video and creative tools

-Exposure to high-end SaaS, VC, and tech clients

-Portfolio work that's elevated, not template spam

-Skills that differentiate you in the creative market

-A chance to help shape how the studio works



The honest truth:

We're not a massive agency. We're a small, focused team. We're building systems that don't fully exist yet. If you want everything polished and buttoned-up from day one, this isn't the role.



But if you're curious, ambitious, and want to be part of something that's ahead of where most studios are going, this could be a great fit.



How this works:

We'll start with a project-based relationship ‚Äî real client work, real deadlines, real collaboration.

This lets us both figure out if it's the right fit:



1. Do you work well with our creative direction style?

2. Do you take ownership of projects?

3. Do we communicate clearly?

4. Is the work energizing or draining for you?



If it works, we'll transition to a full-time role with consistent projects, growth opportunities, and long-term partnership.



If it doesn't, no hard feelings you'll have added solid portfolio pieces and learned some new tools.



We're looking for a long-term tea
mber, but we want to make sure we're both confident before making that commitment.



Application requirements:



Send us:



1. Portfolio ‚Äî 5‚Äì8 examples of motion work you're proud of (Vimeo, Drive, or portfolio site). Please do not send a google drive link with every video you have created. Show me your best work you are most proud of.

2. A video intro, tell us about yourself. What you like to do in your free time, where you hang out on the internet, how you got into motion design, what you are looking for in your career, and why you think you are the right fit for this job.

3. AI curiosity check ‚Äî Have you used any AI tools for video, design, or creative work? If yes, what? If no, what are you curious about?

4. Why VAAS ‚Äî 3‚Äì4 sentences on why this role interests you (real reasoning, not a cover letter)

5. Availability ‚Äî Can you start with project-based work in the next 2‚Äì4 weeks?



Details:

-Starts as project-based, transitions to full-time for the right person

-Project rate: Competitive per-project pricing based on scope

-Full-time rate (if we move forward): $900‚Äì$1,300/month depending on experience

-Remote, flexible hours

-Reports to: Founder

title: Customer Service Support
description:
Company: Trimly by Astro Health Clinic

Website: trimly.sg





Location: Fully Remote (Singapore-based operations)

Job Type: Full-Time

Working Hours: 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM (Monday to Friday)

Salary: USD $600 - $700 per month + USD $1 per enquiry-to-booking conversions



About Us

Trimly is a leading weight loss telemedicine provider in Singapore, specializing in online consultations for GLP-1 medications and personalized weight management programs. We are dedicated to helping patients achieve their health goals through accessible, virtual healthcare services. As we expand our operations, we are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Operations and Customer Service Associate to join our remote team and support our growing patient base.



Job Summary

In this fully remote role, you will play a key part in ensuring smooth daily operations and delivering exceptional customer service to our patients. You will be managing 20-30 enquiries per day with 90% customer satisfaction and 30% enquiry-to-booking enquiries. 



Key Responsibilities

- Respond promptly and professionally to patient enquiries via text

- Send timely appointment reminders to both new and existing patients to ensure high attendance rates.

- Book follow-up appointments post-consultation, coordinating with doctors and patients for optimal scheduling.

- Follow up on outstanding payments, including chasing overdue amounts in a polite and efficient manner.

- Generate and send invoices to patients, ensuring accuracy and compliance with billing procedures.

- Assist with other administrative duties as needed to support clinic operations.



Requirements

- Fluent in English (both written and spoken) with excellent communication skills.

- Proven ability to craft and follow Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) in a professional setting.

- IT-savvy with proficiency in using computer systems, including CRM software,
 platforms, scheduling tools, and Microsoft Office/Google Workspace.

- Friendly, enthusiastic, and customer-oriented personality with a passion for helping others.

- Ability to work fully remote with a reliable internet connection and a dedicated workspace.

- Prior experience in customer service, operations, or healthcare administration is preferred but not required.



What We Offer

- Competitive base salary of SGD $600 - $700 per month

- USD $1 per enquiry-to-booking conversions

- Fully remote work environment with flexible tools for collaboration.

- Opportunities for professional growth in a dynamic telemedicine startup.

- Supportive team culture focused on work-life balance.



Please submit a 1-minute video introduction, explaining why you are ideal for this specific role. Include the word 'pineapple' in your response to show you read this post.

title: YouTube Production Coordinator (AI Operations)
description:
We are a high-volume media company running multiple YouTube channels. We are NOT looking for a creative writer. We are looking for an organized "Operator" to run our production line.



If you are a creative writer who wants to write your own stories, DO NOT APPLY.

If you are a highly organized Project Manager who loves AI tools, checklists, and hitting deadlines, this is for you.



YOUR ROLE:

You will be the "Engine" of our production. You will take ideas, turn them into assets using our AI tools, and manage our team of editors to ensure videos are finished on time.



SPECIFIC RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. AI Script Generation (Daily):

- You will take approved topics from our Trello board.

- You will use our specific "Prompt Guide" and Claude AI to generate scripts.

- You will compile the script sections into Google Docs. (No creative writing required, just precise execution of our system).



2. Voiceover Generation:

- You will use our TTS tool to generate voiceovers.

- You will check our 
 "Pinned Messages" to ensure you use the correct Voice ID and settings for each channel.

- You will audit the audio files to ensure no glitches before sending them to editors.



3. Production Management (Trello & 
):

- You will assign the Script and Voiceover to our Editors and Thumbnail Designers on Trello.

- You will ensure the Designer knows which script to follow for the thumbnail.

- You are responsible for the deadline. You must message editors on 
 daily. If they are late, you chase them.



4. Quality Control & Uploading:

- When an editor submits a video, you check it using our checklist.

- If it passes, you upload it to YouTube using our Templates.

- If it fails, you tag the editor for revisions.



REQUIREMENTS:

- EXTREMELY ORGANIZED: You will manage up to 6 channels. You must never lose a file or forget to tag a tea
mber.

- TECH SAVVY: You must be comfortable using Trello, 
, Google Drive, and learning new AI tools quickly.

- FAST INTERNET: You will be uploading large video files to YouTube. Slow internet will not work.

- HIGH AVAILABILITY: You need to be online during your shift to unblock editors if they have questions.



HOW TO APPLY (Strict Instructions):

We entirely ignore generic AI written applications. To be considered, you must follow these 3 steps exactly:



1. Record a 60-second LOOM video (screen recording) of your desktop.

- In the video, show me how you currently organize your files or your daily to-do list. I want to see that you are tidy and organized.

- Speak in the video so I can hear your microphone quality/English level.

2. In your loom video, you must show your internet speed test results from speedtest.net.

3. Make the Subject Line of your application: "YOUTUBE OPERATOR - [Your Favorite Color]"



If you do not include the Loom video or the specific subject line, your application will be archived immediately.
