title: Senior SEO & CRO Specialist ‚Äì Long-Term Partnership for Established E-Commerce Brand
description:
**About Us**

We are Love Furniture, a well-established online furniture retailer with 19 years of trading history across Ireland and the UK. We operate two e-commerce websites serving different markets:

- **www.LoveFurniture.ie** ‚Äì Republic of Ireland (EUR)

- **
** ‚Äì Northern Ireland & UK (GBP)



We run a heavily customized Magento 2.4.7 platform that has been tailored to our specific needs over nearly two decades. We invest significantly in Google Shopping and paid advertising, and have dedicated specialists across various technical and marketing disciplines.



**The Challenge**

Despite our strong market presence and advertising investment, we're experiencing conversion rate challenges that we believe require expert intervention from someone who deeply understands both SEO and CRO disciplines.



**The Opportunity**

We're seeking a **highly skilled SEO and CRO specialist** to join us as a long-term freelance partner. This is not a short-term project ‚Äì we're looking for someone who wants to grow with our business and make a lasting impact on our performance.



**What You'll Be Working With**

- Magento 2.4.7 with extensive custom development

- Multi-country, multi-currency e-commerce setup

- Google Analytics

- Google Search Console

- Google Tag Manager

- Google Ads

- Google Merchant Center

-
 Meta Business Suite

- SEMrush



**What We're Looking For**

You should have:



? **Deep expertise in both SEO and CRO** ‚Äì We need someone who can seamlessly handle both disciplines at a senior level



? **E-commerce experience** ‚Äì Preferably with Magento or similarly complex platforms



? **Multi-market knowledge** ‚Äì Understanding of international SEO, hreflang implementation, and localized conversion optimization



? **Technical proficiency** ‚Äì Comfortable working with heavily customized platforms and understanding technical constraints



? **Data-driven approach** ‚Äì Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data from multiple sources and translate insights into action



? **Proven track record** ‚Äì Demonstrable results in improving both organic visibility and conversion rates for e-commerce businesses



? **Strategic thinking** ‚Äì Ability to develop and execute long-term strategies while managing day-to-day optimizations



? **Excellent communication** ‚Äì You'll be working with our existing team of specialists and need to collaborate effectively



**Scope of Work**

This role will encompass:

- **SEO:** Technical audits, on-page optimization, content strategy, link building, international SEO implementation, ongoing monitoring and improvements

- **CRO:** Conversion funnel analysis, A/B testing strategy and implementation, user experience optimization, checkout optimization, landing page improvements

- Collaboration with our existing technical and marketing teams

- Regular reporting and strategic recommendations

- Staying ahead of algorithm updates and industry best practices



**What We Offer**

- Long-term partnership opportunity with an established, stable business

- The chance to make significant impact on a mature e-commerce operation

- Work with a supportive team that values expertise

- Flexible remote working arrangement

- Competitive compensation for the right candidate



---



## How to Apply

To help us process applications efficiently, please **submit a video introduction** (5-10 minutes) covering:

1. **Who you are** ‚Äì Brief personal and professional background

2. **Your skill set** ‚Äì Specific experience in SEO and CRO, particularly for e-commerce

3. **Relevant work** ‚Äì Examples of your most relevant projects and the results you achieved (specifics and metrics appreciated)

4. **Your rate** ‚Äì What you would need to be paid  (hourly rate)

5. **Your availability** ‚Äì When you could start and how many hours per week/month you could commit



**Please upload your video to 
 (or similar platform) and send us the link.**



We're excited to find the right partner to help take Love Furniture to the next level. If you have the skills, experience, and ambition to make a real difference in our business, we'd love to hear from you.



---



**Important Note:** We're looking for one exceptional person who can handle both SEO and CRO at a senior level. While we understand these are distinct specializations, we believe the right candidate will have evolved their expertise across both areas and understand how they complement each other in driving e-commerce success.

title: Staff Accountant
description:
Instructions: 



1) Please take this survey as part of the application process for this position: 

2) Send a message describing your interest in the position



Reports To: Accounting Manager / CFO



About the Role - hybrid remote - onsite BGC, Taguig



Life Science Center is seeking a Staff Accountant with strong technical skills in general ledger management, accounts payable/receivable, and compliance with Philippine tax laws and regulatory filings. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proactive, and capable of supporting multi-entity operations while maintaining accuracy and timeliness in financial reporting.



Key Responsibilities



1. General Ledger Management

2. Post journal entries and maintain accurate, up-to-date general ledger accounts.

3. Perform monthly account reconciliations (bank, credit card, intercompany, etc.).

4. Support month-end and year-end closing processes.

5. Accounts Payable & Receivable

6. Process vendor invoices, employee reimbursements, and supplier payments.

7. Ensure proper coding, approvals, and timely settlement of liabilities.

8. Issue client invoices, track collections, and reconcile AR aging.

9. Tax Compliance & Filings: MAP & SAWT, RELIEF, Semestral List of Regular Suppliers

10. Prepare and file monthly, quarterly, and annual tax returns (e.g., VAT, EWT, Income Tax) in compliance with BIR regulations.

11. Submission of AFS to BIR via ORUS system.

12. Secure and renewal of business registrations & permits with local government and other governing bodies such as but not limited to SEC, BOI, DTI, as necessary.

13. Submission of AFS, GIS, and GFFS to SEC.

14. Maintain organized tax records and schedules to support audits and examinations.

15. Monitor changes in Philippine tax laws and ensure compliance.

16. Reporting & Support

17. Assist in preparing financial statements and management reports.

18. Provide schedules and supporting documents for audits and external reviews.

19. Coordinate with external accountants, auditors, and regulators as required.



Qualifications

‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field (CPA preferred but not required).

‚Ä¢ Minimum 3 years of accounting experience with emphasis on GL, AP/AR, and Philippine tax compliance.

‚Ä¢ Strong working knowledge of BIR processes, deadlines, and eFPS/eBIRForms filing.

‚Ä¢ Proficiency in QuickBooks Online (QBO) or similar ERP/accounting systems.

‚Ä¢ Solid understanding of accrual-based accounting and reconciliation best practices.

‚Ä¢ High attention to detail, with strong organizational and time management skills.

‚Ä¢ Success Metrics

a. All BIR filings submitted 100% on time with no penalties.

b. AP/AR aging maintained within agreed thresholds (e.g., no payables over 30 days without approval, AR collections monitored weekly).

c. Month-end close and reconciliations completed within 7‚Äì10 business days.

d. Zero recurring errors in GL postings or reconciliations.

title: Virtual Assistant ‚Äî Temporary Housing Operations
description:
Virtual Assistant ‚Äî Temporary Housing Operations

The Role:

We're looking for a reliable, detail-oriented VA to help manage our tenant placement pipeline ‚Äî from finding available properties to coordinating leases. You'll be a key part of our daily operations.

title: Remote Accounting Coordinator (Work from Home)
description:
Remote Accounting Coordinator (Work from Home)

CAD $9 to $10 per hour | 9-hour shifts | Eastern Time zone coverage

Independet Contractor



A growing North American facilities services organization is expanding its remote accounting support and is seeking dependable, detail-oriented professionals. This is a work-from-home independent contractor engagement supporting commercial and retail clients across Canada.



The role is paid weekly upon receipt of invoice. The schedule is 9-hour shifts, five (5) days per week. Occasional Saturday shifts (approximately once per month) may be required. Shifts align with Eastern Standard Time: 8:00‚Äì5:00, 9:00‚Äì6:00, or 10:00‚Äì7:00 EST.



Role Overview

This is a fast-moving, highly collaborative accounting support engagement within a structured, system-driven environment. Work is coordinated in real time via Zoom and internal platforms to ensure financial accuracy and maintain workflow efficiency.



As part of the accounting support function, you will work closely with internal teams, vendors, and clients, as well as play a key role in maintaining accurate financial records, supporting billing processes, and ensuring smooth daily operations. 



What You‚Äôll Do

Customer Invoicing: Generate invoices, track deposits, process purchase order invoicing, support job costing, and assist with new client setup.

Accounts Receivable & Payable Support: Post daily cash receipts, support accounts payable data entry, assist with credit card reconciliations, and coordinate vendor payments.

Collections & Follow-Up: Monitor aging reports, follow up on outstanding receivables, issue delinquency notices, and assist in resolving invoice disputes professionally and efficiently.

Financial Reporting Support: Prepare ad-hoc management reports, create financial schedules as needed, and assist with month-end close tasks.

Documentation & Compliance: Review supporting documentation, such as work orders, approvals, and sign-offs, to ensure billing accuracy and audit readiness.

Vendor & Client Communication: Serve as a professional liaison between internal teams, vendors, and customers to resolve discrepancies and maintain positive relationships.

Process Improvement: Identify workflow inefficiencies and recommend improvements to strengthen accounting operations.



Requirements for Home Office Set-Up

‚Ä¢ Preferred: Windows PC running Windows 11.

‚Ä¢ Minimum 300 Mbps internet speed (600 Mbps preferred); fibre connection strongly preferred.

‚Ä¢ Multiple monitors required (single monitor setups are not suitable).

‚Ä¢ High-quality headset with microphone.

‚Ä¢ Reliable webcam.

‚Ä¢ Quiet, professional workspace suitable for full-day Zoom collaboration.



What You Bring

Accounting Experience: Previous experience in accounts receivable, accounts payable, invoicing, or bookkeeping support is required. Experience working in remote or virtual accounting environments preferred.

Technical Proficiency: Strong Microsoft Office skills, particularly Excel. Comfortable working across multiple systems, databases, and accounting platforms simultaneously.

Organization: You can handle high
 volumes, prioritize tasks, and keep everything on track.

Problem-solving: You take initiative, think independently, and easily resolve issues.

Collaborative Communicator: You work confidently with others, fostering accountability and motivation. You are a positive, self-motivated individual with clear communication.

Composed Under Pressure: You enjoy working within tight deadlines with close attention to detail in a fast-paced environment.

You will be paid per campaign setup. It starts part-time and can grow into consistent ongoing work up to $500+ per month .





THE JOB



When we get a new client we will hand you their info and you set up and launch their ad campaign. This includes:



- Setting up their campaign inside
 Ads Manager (targeting, placements, budget, etc.)



- Basic work inside
 Business Manager and Events Manager (pixels, tracking, general navigation)



- Creating 10-20 short vertical video ads per client ‚Äî think Snapchat/Reels style. Adding lyrics over video, cutting clips together, matching visuals to the song vibe. Nothing super advanced ‚Äî Canva level stuff.



- Uploading everything to Google Drive, updating a tracker in Google Sheets



We have step-by-step video training and written SOPs for everypart of the process.



We will literally show you what to click. You just need to be the kind of person who can follow instructions carefully and pay attention to detail.





WHAT HELPS



- Some experience with
 Ads Manager or at least comfort clicking around marketing platforms and learning new software quickly



- Canva, CapCut, Premiere, or any basic video editing tool - you will be making short vertical videos with text, lyrics, and music



- A good eye for content ‚Äî being able to listen to a song and find visuals that match the vibe. If you have a feel for what performs on Reels or TikTok that is a big plus.



- Google Sheets and Google Drive (basic)



- Conversational English (written). Does not need to be perfect. Fluent spoken English is a plus.







BEFORE YOU REPLY



Put your #1 strongest skill as your subject line. Pick one:



  - Meta Ads

  - Canva

  - Video Editing

  - Content Creation

  - Identifying Trends



Example: "Application ‚Äî Canva"



No subject line = application skip



HOW TO REPLY



Keep it brief. Just tell us:



- A few sentences on any experience you have with Meta Ads or
 Ads Manager (even if basic)



- What video editing tools you use



- Any experience with content creation, music, or finding trending content



- Your availability and timezone



That is it. We will follow up with a quick test task for the strongest applicants.

title: Full Time YouTube Documentary Editor
description:

- Understanding of pacing, retention, and audience engagement

- Strong attention to detail and ability to follow brand style

- Competitive monthly salary (based on experience)

- Remote position with flexible working hours

- Opportunity to grow with expanding channels

1. A short introduction about yourself

2. Links to past YouTube documentary edits

3. Your expected monthly rate

title: Junior React Native Developer (Part-Time, Long-Term Growth Role)
description:
About Sprout Network



Sprout Network is a fast-growing mobile app focused on building a large-scale digital ecosystem with long-term blockchain ambitions. We are currently focused on strengthening and expanding our live mobile application while continuing development toward future infrastructure goals.



Our app currently has:



500,000+ total downloads



70,000+ daily active users



10,000+ reviews on the Google Play Store



You will be working on a real production app with real users at scale.



We are looking for a junior developer who wants to grow long-term with the company. This is not a short-term freelance gig. This is a growth position with clear pay increases based on performance and independence.



Position Details



Role: Junior React Native Developer

Type: Part-Time

Hours: 25 hours per week

Schedule: 5 hours per day, Monday ‚Äì Thursday

Time Zone Requirement: Must work within 5:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM EST

(Your exact 5-hour shift will be chosen within this window upon hiring)



This role has strong potential to become full-time in the future.



We hold:



A start-of-week meeting every Monday



An end-of-week meeting every Thursday



Clear communication and reliability are extremely important.



Compensation



Starting Pay: $5.25 per hour



100 hours per month



$525 per month to start



Paid biweekly



Once you are able to independently work inside the app without heavy supervision:



Your pay increases to $7.00 per hour



After that, you receive a $0.25 raise every month



There is no salary cap. This position rewards developers who prove themselves and stay long term.



If you are looking for a stable growth plan where performance directly increases your income, this is for you.



What You‚Äôll Be Working On



You will work directly with our lead developer and assist with:



Feature development in a live production app



Bug fixes and edge case handling



Improving UI components



Supporting earning logic and timer systems



Assisting with referral logic and data consistency



Helping maintain ad flow integrations



Supporting internal tools when needed



Tech Stack

Mobile



React Native



Expo



Firebase (Auth, Firestore)



Google & Apple Sign-In



AdMob (rewarded ads + banner flows)



Web / Internal Tools



Next.js



Tailwind CSS



General



Git / GitHub



Clean component architecture



Clear error handling



Proper state management



Required Skills



React Native (Expo experience required)



Firebase (Firestore + Auth)



Ability to work inside an existing codebase



Git version control



Solid English communication (clear updates and explanations)



Ability to follow direction and collaborate with a lead developer



Who This Is For



This is for someone who:



Wants long-term stability



Wants raises based on real performance



Is coachable and eager to grow



Takes pride in writing clean code



Wants to work on an app with real scale



We care more about your willingness to grow and communicate clearly than being a senior expert.



How To Apply



Please include:



Links to your GitHub or React Native projects



A short explanation of your experience with Firebase



Confirmation that you can work within the required EST time range



Your internet speed (upload and download)



The word ‚ÄúSproutGrowth‚Äù in your application subject line



Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed

title: Virtual Assistant who #Believes in Entrepreneurs | Flexible Schedule
description:
We're trying to solve the world's biggest problem: People don't #Believe in themselves enough. For over 22 years, Evan Carmichael has been dedicated to this mission. The way we're approaching this problem is producing inspirational content at scale. The right video at the right time can completely change someone's life and we want to touch as many lives as possible. People may not have a supportive family or community around them, but our content can help give them the belief they need to chase their dreams and make the world a better place. We want to work with people who also want to make an impact and touch people's lives. In your application, please put ‚ÄòI am your next awesome VA!‚Äô in the subject line. We‚Äôre looking for someone who‚Äôs curious, kind, takes initiative, wants to grow, and cares about being part of something meaningful. Please also share the link to your resume and portfolio, what your hourly salary expectations are, and in the first line of your message tell us how many YouTube subscribers Evan Carmichael has, followed by who your favorite entrepreneur of all time is and why. Please make sure to send your job application here on OnlineJobs and not via
. The job is full time (40 hours per week) with a flexible schedule. We would start off with a small project for now and we'd pay you for your ideas and research. We also like to work with people over a long period of time, not just short contracts, and give them opportunities to succeed and do more based on what they want to learn. Hopefully that will be you! Thank you for reading and good luck! Sending lots of love! Irish #Believe

title: AI graphic designer
description:
Graphic Designer (Growth Path Into Marketing & Creative Direction)



We‚Äôre looking for a skilled graphic designer to join our creative team.

This role is perfect for someone who enjoys designing but also wants to learn the marketing side behind high-performing ads.



You‚Äôll work inside a team of designers and collaborate directly with our marketing department. If you want long-term growth, structure, and a chance to develop into a more strategic creative role, this is for you.



What You‚Äôll Do



Create 20 high-quality static ads per day (product shots, collages, lifestyle scenes, simple UGC-style frames)



Work in a team of multiple graphic designers



Use Gemini / Canva / Photoshop (or your preferred workflow)



Design ads that look trustworthy, clean, and authentic



Help brainstorm new creative angles and concepts



Follow brand guidelines and maintain a consistent visual identity



Use performance feedback to improve your designs



Salary & Bonus System



Base salary: $400/month



Bonus system: the best-performing designer can DOUBLE their salary



Bonuses are based on creative performance and impact



Clear structure, transparent system



Top creatives get rewarded heavily



This isn‚Äôt a typical low-level design job ‚Äî we invest in designers who show growth and ownership.



What You‚Äôll Learn



You don‚Äôt need previous marketing experience ‚Äî you will learn it on the job.



You‚Äôll gain real performance marketing knowledge, including:



What makes an ad convert



How to build creatives using trust / scarcity / authority / offer principles



How to read basic performance data (CTR, CPC, Hook Rate)



How to think in marketing angles, not just visuals



How to build creatives for older demographics (40‚Äì70+)



How real ecommerce brands scale through creative testing



If you want to grow from a designer ? into someone who understands marketing ? and eventually creative direction, this role gives you that path.



Who We‚Äôre Looking For



A graphic designer with a good eye and strong aesthetic taste



Able to design fast while keeping quality high



Comfortable giving and receiving feedback



Interested in learning the marketing strategy behind your work



Reliable, consistent, and proactive



Someone who wants long-term growth, not just tasks



Bonus Skills



(Not required, but helpful)



Meta/Facebook ad experience



Photoshop or advanced Canva knowledge



Ecommerce or jewelry ad experience



Understanding of performance metrics



Why Join Us



100% remote



Work inside a structured creative team, not alone



Clear expectations, clear goals



Fast feedback loops



A stable brand with long-term growth



A real opportunity to move into creative direction + marketing if you grow



This role is for someone who takes pride in their work and wants to be part of a bigger creative engine ‚Äî not just a production designer.

title: Chargeback Manager (E-commerce / Dropshipping)
description:
Role Overview



We are looking for a Chargeback Manager who owns chargeback and refund performance end-to-end. Your main responsibility is to track, analyze, and reduce chargebacks and refunds by identifying root causes and translating insights into clear, actionable improvements for Customer Support, Operations, and the business.



This is a hands-on, data-driven role with direct impact on payment processor health, PayPal account stability, and overall profitability.



Key Responsibilities

Chargeback & Refund Tracking



Track daily, weekly, and monthly chargeback rates across all payment providers



Track refund rates and identify trends, spikes, and anomalies



Monitor processor thresholds to prevent:



Account warnings



Rolling reserves



Payment account shutdowns



Maintain structured reports showing:



Chargeback rate (%)



Refund rate (%)



Dispute outcomes (won / lost)



Reason codes and categories



Investigation & Root Cause Analysis



Investigate each chargeback and PayPal dispute to determine:



True root cause (CS handling, delivery delays, unclear expectations, fraud, etc.)



Whether the dispute was preventable



Classify disputes into actionable categories rather than generic labels



Identify recurring issues at:



Customer Support agent level



Policy level



Store / funnel level



PayPal Dispute Management



Handle and optimize PayPal disputes and claims end-to-end



Understand PayPal reason codes, evidence requirements, and deadlines



Improve win rates by submitting strong, structured evidence



Track PayPal dispute health metrics and report risks early



Reporting & Feedback Loop



Provide clear, data-backed feedback to:



Customer Support



Management



Report when:



CS agents can improve communication or decision-making



Refunds are issued too late or inconsistently



Policies or scripts are causing avoidable disputes



Turn insights into specific improvement actions



Dropshipping & Operational Alignment



Analyze disputes in the context of dropshipping operations:



Shipping times



Tracking quality



Supplier delays or errors



Identify when chargebacks are caused by:



Fulfillment issues



Poor expectation setting



Incorrect delivery communication



Work with CS to preempt disputes through proactive refunds or messaging



Requirements



Proven experience with PayPal disputes and claims (required)



Hands-on dropshipping experience (required)



Strong understanding of:



Chargeback reason codes



Refund workflows



Payment processor thresholds



Strong analytical and reporting skills



Comfortable giving direct, constructive feedback to teams



Experience working with Customer Support teams in e-commerce environments

Management

title: CRO Manager
description:
About Us

We are a fast-growing multi brand global company specialising in natural cosmetics and organic food, expanding rapidly across the UK, EU, and international markets. We are looking for an experienced CRO Manager to improve conversion, lead social and
, coordinate with tech implementation, and aligning overall cross-channel execution.



Role Overview

The CRO Manager is responsible for driving organic performance by leading CRO initiatives and optimising the website across key customer journey touchpoints, including landing pages, product pages, and checkout flows.

This role also oversees social media and
 marketing to ensure all organic channels are strategically planned, on brand, and aligned with growth objectives. A core focus of the role is identifying drop off points, running structured tests, and improving conversion rates through data driven optimisation.

The CRO Manager collaborates closely with the tech team to implement website improvements and partners with the Paid Growth Lead to align strategies and repurpose high performing paid content across organic channels.

This is a hands on, performance focused role for someone who can blend creative thinking with analytical rigour to accelerate growth.



Key Responsibilities:

‚Ä¢ Lead CRO strategy and optimise landing pages, product pages, and checkout flows.

‚Ä¢ Run A/B tests and use data to improve conversion rates.

‚Ä¢ Oversee social media and
 marketing to support organic growth.

‚Ä¢ Work with the tech team to implement website improvements.

‚Ä¢ Align with the Paid Growth Lead and repurpose high performing paid content for organic channels.

‚Ä¢ Monitor performance across organic channels and provide actionable insights.



Requirements:

‚Ä¢ Minimum 5+ years of experience in CRO, organic growth-focused roles., E-commerce specifically in both Shopify and Amazon.

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of customer journeys, UX principles, and conversion psychology.

‚Ä¢ Hands-on experience with A/B testing tools and website optimisation platforms.

‚Ä¢ Solid knowledge and experience of social media and
 marketing best practices.

‚Ä¢ Comfortable analysing data and turning insights into clear optimisation actions.

‚Ä¢ Strong understanding of Shopify, analytics platforms, and CRO tools (Google Analytics, Hotjar, VWO, Convert, etc.).

‚Ä¢ Ability to collaborate with tech, creative, and paid media teams. 

‚Ä¢ Strong organisational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects at once.

We are hiring a motivated Appointment Setter / Dialer Operator to generate and qualify appointments for solar energy and roofing projects. This role focuses on outbound calling using an auto-dialer, speaking with homeowners, identifying interest, and booking qualified appointments for our sales team.



You will be contacting residential homeowners only. No closing, no selling contracts‚Äîyour job is to open the door and set solid appointments.

title: Call Center Manager
description:
Call Center Manager ‚Äî Job Description



Empire Home Remodeling



Position Summary



The Call Center Manager is responsible for overseeing the daily operations and performance of the call center at Empire Home Remodeling. This role ensures efficient lead handling, appointment setting, customer communication, and overall team productivity.



The Call Center Manager develops processes, monitors performance metrics, manages call quality, and implements strategies to maximize appointment quality, conversion rates, and overall operational efficiency.



We are seeking an experienced Call Center Manager with a proven ability to lead teams, manage performance, and drive results in a fast-paced environment. Home improvement industry experience is preferred but not required.



Primary Responsibilities

Contact rate

Lead response time

title: Inbound Sales Closer ‚Äì High-Energy, High-Earning Opportunity
description:
We‚Äôre a fast-growing digital marketing agency, and we‚Äôve built a lead machine that‚Äôs generating 15‚Äì50 warm, inbound leads per day. These aren‚Äôt random prospects - they‚Äôre reaching out to us because they want what we offer. Now, we need a killer closer to jump in and turn interest into revenue.



This is a remote, part-time role with a flexible schedule, paid training, and a real opportunity to make serious money if you know how to work the phones and follow a proven process.



Why This Role Is Different

???? No cold calling ‚Äì all leads are inbound and requesting help.

???? Instant connection tech ‚Äì when a lead comes in, your phone rings, you press a button, and you‚Äôre talking to them immediately.

???? Speed-to-lead = bigger commissions ‚Äì the faster you connect, the higher your close rate.

???? Proven process ‚Äì we‚Äôve built and refined a sales system designed to win. You just need to follow it.



Your Mission

Your #1 job: Close deals.



But it‚Äôs more than that. You‚Äôll:

Jump on inbound calls the second a lead comes in (SPEED = MONEY).

Walk prospects through our short, powerful sales deck.

Showcase exactly how our agency can deliver them qualified leads fast.

Gather key details to personalize proposals (we handle the proposals for you).

Follow up with prospects, keep deals moving through your pipeline, and collect payments.

Bottom line: Your success is measured by closed revenue, not endless outreach.



The Daily Flow

Lead Comes In ? Your Phone Rings

Tap a button. You‚Äôre instantly connected.

Engage Fast.

Follow up on the leads you're unable to reach.

Answer questions, set up a quick demo, or walk them through the pitch right there.



Close or Move Them Forward

If they‚Äôre ready ? close them on the spot.

title: Tech VA
description:
JL Marketing is a fast-growing Meta Badged Partner specializing in lead generation for health, wellness, and fitness businesses. We're excited to expand our remote team and are looking for a Tech VA (Tech Virtual Assistant) who is passionate about technology, eager to learn new skills, and excited to become an integral part of our team! If you're a self-starter with a great attitude and a desire to grow your tech abilities, this is the perfect opportunity for you. We are only reviewing applications submitted through our website.



Role Overview



We're searching for a dedicated Tech VA (Tech Virtual Assistant) to support our tech team. In this role, you'll get hands-on experience with various technologies and processes, including helping with our CRM platform (HubSpot), assisting with simple automations, and supporting web updates. This is an entry-level position where we'll provide full training on everything you need to know. You'll have a fantastic opportunity to learn and grow within an innovative tech environment.



Responsibilities



Support CRM Tasks: Help with managing our CRM (HubSpot), including entering data, keeping information organized, and supporting basic workflow setups.

Assist with Automations: Learn to assist in creating and managing simple automations to help our internal operations run more smoothly.

Web Asset Support: Learn to help manage and update web assets, including WordPress sites, to ensure they're user-friendly and up-to-date.

Technical Assistance: Work alongside our tech team to help identify and resolve minor technical issues.

Project Coordination: Assist in keeping track of project progress and providing updates to the team.



Qualifications



Eager to Learn: A strong interest in technology and a genuine desire to learn new software, systems, and processes.

Great Listener & Follows Directions: Excellent at understanding and following instructions carefully.

Team Player: Open to collaborating with a supportive team and contributing to a positive work environment.

Reliable Communication: Good written and verbal English communication skills, with a proactive approach to asking questions and providing updates.

Comfortable with Remote Work: Able to work effectively from home and align your working hours closely with US time zones.



What We Offer



Full Training Provided: We are committed to teaching you everything you need to succeed in this role‚Äîno prior experience required!

Competitive Compensation: We offer competitive pay for motivated individuals.

Flexible Remote Work: Enjoy the flexibility of a fully remote position, allowing you to work from anywhere.

Growth & Learning: Opportunity to work with a fun, supportive team and contribute to innovative projects in the AI automation and marketing space.

Collaborative Environment: Join a dynamic team that meets daily on Zoom, with regular huddles to align on goals and share ideas. Your contributions will be valued and make a real impact.



How to Apply



Ready to start your tech journey and join a dynamic team at JL Marketing? We are only reviewing applications submitted through our website. To demonstrate your attention to detail, please start your answer to the final question on the application form with the word BLUE. Please fill out our application here: 
/tech-va-hiring-application/



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Full Cycle Sales Development Representative
description:

CareAutomate | Remote (Philippines) | Full-time



About the role

We're looking for a Full Cycle Sales Development Representative to join our growing sales team. In this role, you'll be responsible for the full sales cycle‚Äîfrom identifying and qualifying prospects to closing deals with healthcare agencies across the United States.

As an SDR at CareAutomate, you'll introduce our platform to housing service providers who are struggling with manual billing processes and administrative overhead. You'll help them understand how our solution can transform their operations, and guide them through the evaluation and purchase process.

This is a high-impact role where your success directly influences our growth trajectory and our ability to serve more healthcare providers.



What you'll do



Identify and engage potential customers through outbound prospecting (cold calling,
, LinkedIn)

Conduct discovery calls to understand prospect needs and qualify opportunities

Deliver product demonstrations and articulate our value proposition to decision-makers

Navigate the sales process from initial contact through contract signature

Build and maintain a healthy pipeline of opportunities

Collaborate with the sales team to refine messaging and improve conversion rates

Meet and exceed monthly sales targets

Maintain accurate records of all activities and opportunities in our CRM



What we're looking for

Required qualifications



1-2 years of experience in B2B sales, preferably in SaaS or technology

Proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales quotas

Strong cold calling skills with experience making 50+ calls per day

Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English

Experience with CRM systems (HubSpot, Salesforce, or similar)

Self-motivated with the ability to work independently in a remote environment

Availability to work US Eastern Time business hours (9 AM - 6 PM EST)



Preferred qualifications:



Experience selling to Home care agencies

Familiarity with Medicaid billing or homecare operations

Background in full-cycle sales (prospecting through closing)

Previous remote work experience

Demonstrated ability to learn technical products quickly



Technical requirements:



Reliable high-speed internet connection (minimum 25 Mbps download, 10 Mbps upload)

Quiet, professional workspace free from distractions

Computer with webcam and microphone suitable for video calls

Backup internet connectivity





About CareAutomate

CareAutomate is a home and community based service technology company building software that helps housing service providers automate their operations. Our platform serves agencies across all 50 US states, helping them streamline Medicaid billing, scheduling, compliance, and case management.

We're a rapidly growing team solving real problems for an underserved market. 



What we offer :

Compensation



Competitive base salary($500 USD) plus uncapped monthly commission structure

Monthly performance bonuses for exceeding targets

Quarterly team incentives and annual recognition programs



Professional development



Comprehensive 3-week onboarding and product training

Ongoing sales methodology training and skill development

Weekly 1-on-1 coaching with your sales manager

Clear path to advancement (Senior SDR, Team Lead, Account Executive roles)

Access to sales enablement resources and learning materials



Work environment



Fully remote position with flexible scheduling

Collaborative team culture with daily standups and team channels

Modern sales tech stack (HubSpot, LinkedIn Sales Navigator)

Access to pre-qualified leads and inbound opportunities

Transparent metrics and real-time performance dashboards



How to apply

Please reply to the job posting .

Subject line: Sales Development Representative - Your Name



Your application should include:



Resume or CV highlighting your sales experience and achievements

Cover letter (300 words max) addressing:



Why you're interested in this role

Your relevant sales experience and results

Your availability and work setup



Hiring process



Application review 

Team interview (60 minutes) - Meet the sales team and hiring manager

Offer and onboarding - Background check, reference verification, and onboarding



We're looking to fill this position by March 1, 2026, and move quickly with qualified candidates.



Our commitment to diversity

CareAutomate is an equal opportunity employer. We're committed to building a diverse team and creating an inclusive culture where everyone can do their best work. We encourage applications from candidates of all backgrounds and experiences.

We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.



Questions?

If you have questions about this role, please reach out to our recruiting team 
 look forward to hearing from you.



CareAutomate | Transforming operations through intelligent automation

Application deadline: Feb 21, 2026

title: Work-from-Home Opportunity with Australian Criminal Law Firm ‚Äì Long-Term Role | Weekend Shift (Sunday-Thursday)
description:
Work-from-Home Opportunity with Australian Criminal Law Firm ‚Äì Long-Term Role | Weekend Shift (Sunday- Thursday)



We are a criminal law firm based in Australia, previously working with external call centres, but now building our dedicated in-house remote team. We currently have 5 valued tea
mbers based in the Philippines and are looking to add a Sixth for a long-term position.







Position Overview



This is a home-based, full-time role with the potential to earn up to PHP 100,000/month ‚Äî starting at PHP 50,000 during training, with a raise to PHP 81,500 post-training, and bonuses up to PHP 10,000 based on commissions.







Schedule & Hours



-Permanent shift: From Sunday- Thursday



-Days off: Friday- Saturday



-11.5 hours per day (including a 45-minute lunch break)



-Working hours: 7:00 AM to approx. 6:30 PM ( There will be a rotation of roster so there are weeks where you only work from 6 AM to 2 PM Philippine time (aligned with Australian business hours and nightphones)



-Training schedule: Monday to Friday until fully trained



- Entitled to 15 vacation leaves

-Answering incoming calls and handling client inquiries professionally

-Fluent English speaker with strong writing and spelling skills



-Reliable computer, high-speed internet, second monitor, and quality headphones (Bluetooth is preferred)



-Availability for full-time work only ‚Äî no side jobs or agency representation



-A strong team player who is eager to learn, grow, and contribute long-term



-Willingness to work on Philippine holidays (with holiday pay already factored in)



-Rarely take leaves on a weekend.







Why Join Us?



-Work closely with a team of 35+ Australian lawyers and staff



-Join a growing and stable firm that values its remote team



-Receive thorough training and continuous support



-Enjoy long-term stability ‚Äî our current PH team has been with us for 3+ years



-We pay the 13th month and offer performance-based bonuses







How to Apply:



-Please submit a voice and video introduction (e.g., via Vocaroo) sharing:



-A short introduction about yourself



-Your relevant experience



-Why you think you‚Äôd be a great fit for this role



-Provide your resume as well.

Do NOT apply if:



You‚Äôre an agency

You don‚Äôt meet the equipment or availability requirements



We use real-time communication tools during working hours, and full commitment to this role is essential.







This is a great opportunity to join a respected and fast-growing Australian law firm ( Dribbin & Brown Criminal Lawyers). Before joining, we‚Äôre happy to connect you with our current Filipino staff so you can hear firsthand about the role and work environment.



We look forward to hearing from you!
